Declare both private copy constructor and copy assignment operator at the same time
Use RAII to prevent resource leaks
The result of the memory allocation function should be cast immediately into a pointer to the allocated type

category.description: Object Oriented
category.name: OOP

rule.header: Class cannot inherit other class more than once unless it is virtual inheritance
Be wary about using multiple inheritance of classes that are not abstract interfaces
Ensure that a derived class has at most one base class which is not an interface class
Do not directly access global data from a constructor
Avoid calling virtual functions from constructors
Avoid calling virtual functions from destructors
Define a virtual destructor in classes used as base classes which have virtual functions
Make destructors virtual in base classes
A pointer to an abstract class shall not be converted to a pointer of a class that inherits from that abstract class
Make base class destructors public and virtual, or protected and nonvirtual
If a class destructor is called and the class has virtual functions it shall have a virtual destructor
Casts from a base class to a derived class should not be performed on polymorphic types
Do not use multiple inheritance
Multiple inheritance shall be limited to at most 1 protected implementation
Multiple inheritance shall not use any public implementations
Avoid using global data in member functions
Avoid "public" data members
Avoid 'protected' data members
If a class has virtual functions it shall have a virtual destructor
Avoid casts down the inheritance hierarchy
Down casting (casting from base to derived class) shall not be allowed
A stateful virtual base shall be explicitly declared in each derived class that accesses it
A base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy
Avoid public copy constructors and assignment operators in base classes
Avoid slicing. Consider Clone instead of copying in base classes
Do not derive functions with the same name from more than one base class
For multiple inheritance use virtual common base class
Avoid the use of global objects in destructors
Avoid using the friend mechanism
Friend declarations shall not be used except declarations of comparison operators
Protected member function shall not return non-const handles to private class-data
Do not redefine an inherited virtual function with a different default parameter value
Avoid explicit cast from derived to a base class
Use the virtual keyword if a subclass implements a virtual function
Avoid declaring virtual functions inline
Never convert pointers to objects of a derived class to pointers to objects of a virtual base class
Declare copy assignment operator for class with reference or const members
Declare the copy constructor and copy assignment operator private not in class itself, but in a specifically designed base class
Never redefine an inherited nonvirtual function
Do not redefine an inherited nonvirtual function with template parameter
Public member functions shall not return non-const handles to private/protected class-data
The copy assignment operator shall be declared protected or private in an abstract class
There shall be no more than one definition of each virtual function on each path through the inheritance hierarchy
All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit
A copy constructor shall only initialize its base classes and the non-static members of the class of which it is a member
Classes should not be derived from virtual bases
Member data in non-POD types shall be private
A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast
Member functions declared in derived class should not hide functions declared in base classes
Do not increase the accessibility of overridden or hidden methods
A user-defined assignment operator shall not be virtual
Structs should only contain public data members and should not be a base or inherit
Write a using declaration to redeclare overloaded functions
Check for assignment to self in operator=
A virtual base shall be explicitly declared in each derived class
Hierarchies should be based on abstract classes
A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual
A pointer to a class may not be converted to a pointer of a second class unless the one inherits from the other
A non-POD type should be defined as class
Consider use composition instead of private inheritance
Prefer composition when don't need inheritance
Use namespace instead of class or structure containing only static functions

category.description: Possible Bugs
category.name: PB

rule.header: Do not call delete on non-pointers
Properly terminate character strings
The class object should be passed by reference if the class has non-static pointers and has no declared copy constructor
Operators should not return value by reference
The definition of a constructor shall not contain default arguments that produce a signature identical to that of the implicitly-declared copy constructor
Unsigned arithmetic shall not be used
Public and protected methods should not be invoked by class constructor
A string literal shall not be modified
The following character sequences shall not appear in header file names: ', \, /*, //, or "
The left-hand operand of a right-shift operator shall not have a negative value
Do not cast from or to incomplete class at the point of casting
Do not delete objects with incomplete class at the point of deletion
Boolean condition always evaluates to the same value due to enumeration with only zero or only non-zero constants
Do not dereference pointer type expressions
Do not use assignments inside a(b), a[b], and cast
Using mixed types in ternary operator is not allowed
Return value of a function must match declared return type
Assignment operator should have operands of compatible types
Do not assign function return value to a variable of incompatible type
Do not assign signed constants to unsigned integer variables
Don't treat arrays polymorphically
Declared types of formal and actual parameters to functions must match
Do not cast a signed char to an unsigned int
Incorrect End-Of-String (EOS) definition
Don't assign the dividend of two integers to a floating-point type
Avoid unintentionally discarding the remainder of integer division
Avoid assigning out-of-range value to char type
Avoid assigning out-of-range value to unsigned char type
Avoid overloading class methods on a pointer and a numerical type
Do not create inline non-member functions that contain local static data
Avoid slicing function arguments / return value
Do not use increment and decrement expressions inside a(b), a[b], and cast
More than one 'enum' type shall not be used as a switch condition or a label in a case statement
Do not call 'sizeof' on constants
Do not call 'sizeof' on a pointer type
Avoid implicit type conversions in assignments involving enum types
Avoid implicit type conversions in comparisons involving enum types
Third parameter to 'memcpy'/'strncpy'/'memmove' should not depend on second
Assignment operators shall not be used in conditions without brackets
The unbounded functions of library <cstring> shall not be used
Narrow and wide string literals shall not be concatenated
String literals with different encoding prefixes shall not be concatenated
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by reference or const reference
A function shall not return a pointer or a reference to a parameter that is passed by const reference
An identifier with array type passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer
Do not pass an expression with array type to a function with a pointer or array type parameter
An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object
All constructors of a class should explicitly call a constructor for all of its immediate base classes and all virtual base classes
The execution of a function registered with 'std::atexit()' or 'std::at_quick_exit()' should not exit via an exception
There should be no mismatch between the '%s' and '%c' format specifiers in the format string and their corresponding arguments in the invocation of a string formatting function
There should be no mismatch between the '%f' format specifier in the format string and its corresponding argument in the invocation of a string formatting function
There should be no mismatch between the '%i' and '%d' format specifiers in the string and their corresponding arguments in the invocation of a string formatting function
There should be no mismatch between the '%u' format specifier in the format string and its corresponding argument in the invocation of a string formatting function
There should be no mismatch between the '%p' format specifier in the format string and its corresponding argument in the invocation of a string formatting function
The number of format specifiers in the format string and the number of corresponding arguments in the invocation of a string formatting function should be equal
Pointer arithmetic shall not be applied to pointers that address variables of non-array type
Avoid overloading global functions on a pointer and a numerical type
Avoid overloading namespace functions on a pointer and a numerical type
Avoid implicit conversions from signed to unsigned type
A pointer to an array of derived class objects should not be converted to a base class pointer
Within an enumerator list, the value of an implicitly-specified enumeration constant shall be unique
Missing comma in a string array initialization
Suspicious argument to malloc
Pointer arithmetic performed on freshly allocated memory
Avoid function calls with incorrect argument order
Function address should not be compared to zero
The values returned by string comparison functions should be compared only to zero
Avoid possible integer overflow in expressions in which the result is assigned to a variable of a wider integer type
Avoid possible integer overflow in expressions in which the result is compared to an expression of a wider integer type
Integer overflow or underflow in constant expression in '+', '-', '*' operator
The same code (after preprocessing) in both branches of if-else statement
An element of an object shall not be initialized more than once
An expression with enum underlying type shall only have values corresponding to the enumerators of the enumeration
Do not copy instances of structures containing a flexible array member
Do not call va_arg with an argument of the incorrect type
The 'abort()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'exit()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'quick_exit()' and '_Exit()' functions from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
C-style strings shall not be used
Expression statements shall not be explicit calls to constructors of temporary objects only
Use intmax_t or uintmax_t for formatted IO on programmer-defined integer types
Avoid function declarations that are syntactically ambiguous
An initializer using chained designators shall not contain initializers without designators
Integer overflow or underflow in constant expression in '<<' operator
Do not add or subtract a constant with a value greater than one from an iterator
Evaluation of constant unsigned integer expressions should not lead to wrap-around

category.description: Qt Best Practices
category.name: QT

rule.header: The methods inside the SIGNAL and SLOT macros have to exist
Do not force thread termination by calling QThread::terminate()
Do not call new on QMutexLocker
Do not directly set specific Widget attributes that are set by Qt kernel
Every QObject subclass should contain a Q_OBJECT macro
QObject must not be inherited more than one time
It's only possible to connect a signal to a slot or a signal to another signal
Mark signal emissions with the keyword "emit" to distinguish a signal emission from a normal method call
Do not set Idle or Critical priority to QThreads. Use High/Low/Med only
If using lock on a mutex in a function, release the lock in the same function
Declare a copy constructor and operator= for any Qt - inherited objects that have pointers
Never mix const and non-const iterators in assignment
If you use Q_DECLARE_FLAGS, you must also use Q_DECLARE_OPERATORS_FOR_FLAGS
Q_DECLARE_OPERATORS_FOR_FLAGS must be in the global namespace, Q_DECLARE_FLAGS inside the enum's namespace
The getters and setters of a Q_PROPERTY must exist and the types must match
Properties of enum types must use Q_ENUMS
Non-const function should not be called on the Qt object
Do not use setWindowFlags function on a Widget
Never use gets()
Use care to ensure that LoadLibrary() will load the correct library
Avoid calling functions printf/wprintf with only one argument other than string constant
Avoid using functions fprintf/fwprintf with only two parameters, when second parameter is a variable
Avoid using data() function from 'string' class of standard library
Avoid using the 'vfork()' function
Avoid using unsecured shell functions that may be affected by shell metacharacters
Avoid using unsafe string functions which may cause buffer overflows
Avoid using unsafe string functions that do not check bounds
Do not use scanf and fscanf functions without specifying variable size in format string
Do not print potentially sensitive information, resulting from an application error into exception messages
Avoid passing non-const parameters or variables into exec
Avoid passing dynamically created strings into exec
Usage of functions prone to race is not allowed
Avoid passing user input into methods as parameters
Do not use 'syslog' function for logging purposes
Do not use mbstowcs() function
Beware of functions which may return the current directory or the windows directory
Avoid using InitializeCriticalSection
Avoid using thread-unsafe functions
Do not use 'setuid' in source code
Don't use chmod(), chown(), chgrp()
Standard random number generators should not be used to generate randomness for security reasons
Do not use obsolete C routine ulimit()
Avoid using 'getpw' function in program code
Do not use 'cuserid' function
Avoid using obsolete C routine 'usleep'
Usage of functions which do not properly handle non-NULL terminated strings is not allowed
Avoid using environment variables
Don't trust any value of command line if attacker can set them
Never use unfiltered data from an untrusted user as the format parameter
Do not use weak encryption functions
Untrusted data is used as a loop boundary
The 'asctime()' and 'asctime_r()' functions should not be used
The random number generator functions 'rand()' and 'srand()' should not be used
Do not use the rand() function for generating pseudorandom numbers
Avoid functions which use time from MFC library
Don't use unsafe C functions that do write to range-unchecked buffers
Use secure temporary file name functions
Specify the access permission bits if a file is created using the 'open' or 'openat' system call
The function 'pthread_setcanceltype()' should not be called with 'PTHREAD_CANCEL_ASYNCHRONOUS' argument
Observe correct revocation order while relinquishing privileges
Ensure that privilege relinquishment is successful
A pointer to a structure should not be passed to a function that can copy data to the user space
Use correct integer precisions when checking the right hand operand of the shift operator
Do not call the 'system()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library with an argument other than '0' (null pointer)
The 'system()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
Do not use the 'char' buffer to store input from 'std::cin'
The 'getenv()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'pthread_kill', 'pthread_sigqueue' and 'tgkill' functions should not be used to send signals to threads
Usage of system properties (environment variables) should be restricted
Call 'umask' before calling 'mkstemp'
Call 'chdir' if you call 'chroot'
Use the 'cnd_signal()' function with a unique condition variable
Do not use the 'notify_one()' function when multiple threads are waiting on the same condition variable

category.description: AUTOSAR C++14 Coding Guidelines
category.name: AUTOSAR

category.description: AUTOSAR A0-1-2 The value returned by a function having a non-void return type that is not an overloaded operator shall be used
category.name: A0_1_2

rule.header: The value returned by a function having a non-void return type that is not an overloaded operator shall always be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A0-1-3 Every function defined in an anonymous namespace, or static function with internal linkage, or private member function shall be used
category.name: A0_1_3

rule.header: Every defined function with internal linkage shall be used at least once

category.description: AUTOSAR A0-1-4 There shall be no unused named parameters in non-virtual functions
category.name: A0_1_4

rule.header: Eliminate unused parameters

category.description: AUTOSAR A0-1-5 There shall be no unused named parameters in the set of parameters for a virtual function and all the functions that override it
category.name: A0_1_5

rule.header: There shall be no unused named parameters in virtual functions

category.description: AUTOSAR A0-4-2 Type long double shall not be used
category.name: A0_4_2

rule.header: Type long double shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A10-1-1 Class shall not be derived from more than one base class which is not an interface class
category.name: A10_1_1

rule.header: Be wary about using multiple inheritance of classes that are not abstract interfaces

category.description: AUTOSAR A10-2-1 Non-virtual member functions shall not be redefined in derived classes
category.name: A10_2_1

rule.header: Never redefine an inherited nonvirtual function
Member functions declared in derived class should not hide functions declared in base classes

category.description: AUTOSAR A10-3-1 Virtual function declaration shall contain exactly one of the three specifiers:
category.name: A10_3_1

rule.header: Only one of virtual, override or final should be specified in a member function declaration

category.description: AUTOSAR A10-3-2 Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with the override or final specifier
category.name: A10_3_2

rule.header: Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with the override or final specifier

category.description: AUTOSAR A10-3-3 Virtual functions shall not be introduced in a final class
category.name: A10_3_3

rule.header: Do not introduce virtual functions in a final class

category.description: AUTOSAR A10-3-5 A user-defined assignment operator shall not be virtual
category.name: A10_3_5

rule.header: A user-defined assignment operator shall not be virtual

category.description: AUTOSAR A11-0-2 A type defined as struct shall: (1) provide only public data members, (2) not provide any special member functions or methods, (3) not be a base of another struct or class, (4) not inherit from another struct or class
category.name: A11_0_2

rule.header: Structs should only contain public data members and should not be a base or inherit

category.description: AUTOSAR A11-3-1 Friend declarations shall not be used
category.name: A11_3_1

rule.header: Friend declarations shall not be used except declarations of comparison operators

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-0-1 If a class declares a copy or move operation, or a destructor, either via "=default", "=delete", or via a user-provided declaration, then all others of these five special member functions shall be declared as well
category.name: A12_0_1

rule.header: If a class declares a copy or move operation, or a destructor, either via '=default', '=delete', or via a user-provided declaration, then all others of these five special member functions shall be declared as well

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-0-2 Bitwise operations and operations that assume data representation in memory shall not be performed on objects
category.name: A12_0_2

rule.header: Do not compare objects of a class that may contain padding bits with C standard library functions

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-1-1 Constructors shall explicitly initialize all virtual base classes, all direct non-virtual base classes and all non-static data members
category.name: A12_1_1

rule.header: All constructors of a class should explicitly call a constructor for all of its immediate base classes and all virtual base classes
All member variables should be initialized in constructor

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-1-2 Both NSDMI and a non-static member initializer in a constructor shall not be used in the same type
category.name: A12_1_2

rule.header: Both NSDMI and a non-static member initializer in a constructor shall not be used in the same type

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-1-3 If all user-defined constructors of a class initialize data members with constant values that are the same across all constructors, then data members shall be initialized using NSDMI instead
category.name: A12_1_3

rule.header: User-defined constructors that initialize data members with the same constant values across all constructors should initialize using NSDMI instead

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-1-4 All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit
category.name: A12_1_4

rule.header: All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-1-5 Common class initialization for non-constant members shall be done by a delegating constructor
category.name: A12_1_5

rule.header: Use delegating constructors to reduce code duplication

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-1-6 Derived classes that do not need further explicit initialization and require all the constructors from the base class shall use inheriting constructors
category.name: A12_1_6

rule.header: Derived classes that do not need further explicit initialization and require all the constructors from the base class shall use inheriting constructors

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-4-1 Destructor of a base class shall be public virtual, public override or protected non-virtual
category.name: A12_4_1

rule.header: Make base class destructors public and virtual, or protected and nonvirtual

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-6-1 All class data members that are initialized by the constructor shall be initialized using member initializers
category.name: A12_6_1

rule.header: Prefer initialization to assignment in constructors

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-7-1 If the behavior of a user-defined special member function is identical to implicitly defined special member function, then it shall be defined "=default" or be left undefined
category.name: A12_7_1

rule.header: Define special members as =default when the behavior is equivalent to the compiler's behavior

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-8-1 Move and copy constructors shall move and respectively copy base classes and data members of a class, without any side effects
category.name: A12_8_1

rule.header: A copy constructor shall only initialize its base classes and the non-static members of the class of which it is a member

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-8-4 Move constructor shall not initialize its class members and base classes using copy semantics
category.name: A12_8_4

rule.header: Use std::move() on rvalue references and std::forward() on forwarding references

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-8-5 A copy assignment and a move assignment operators shall handle self-assignment
category.name: A12_8_5

rule.header: Check for assignment to self in operator=

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-8-6 Copy and move constructors and copy assignment and move assignment operators shall be declared protected or defined "=delete" in base class
category.name: A12_8_6

rule.header: Avoid public copy constructors and assignment operators in base classes

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-1-2 User defined suffixes of the user defined literal operators shall start with underscore followed by one or more letters
category.name: A13_1_2

rule.header: User defined suffixes of the user defined literal operators shall start with underscore followed by one or more letters

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-1-3 User defined literals operators shall only perform conversion of passed parameters
category.name: A13_1_3

rule.header: User defined literals operators shall only perform conversion of passed parameters

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-2-1 An assignment operator shall return a reference to "this"
category.name: A13_2_1

rule.header: Have assignment operator returns a reference to *this; make assignment operator's return type a non-const reference to it's class' type

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-2-2 A binary arithmetic operator and a bitwise operator shall return a "prvalue"
category.name: A13_2_2

rule.header: A binary arithmetic operator and a bitwise operator shall return a 'prvalue'

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-2-3 A relational operator shall return a boolean value
category.name: A13_2_3

rule.header: A relational operator shall return a boolean value

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-3-1 A function that contains "forwarding reference" as its argument shall not be overloaded
category.name: A13_3_1

rule.header: Avoid Overloading on Forwarding References

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-5-1 If "operator[]" is to be overloaded with a non-const version, const version shall also be implemented
category.name: A13_5_1

rule.header: When overloading the subscript operator (operator[]), implement both const and non-const versions

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-5-2 All user-defined conversion operators shall be defined explicit
category.name: A13_5_2

rule.header: User-conversion cast operators should be made explicit

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-5-4 If two opposite operators are defined, one shall be defined in terms of the other
category.name: A13_5_4

rule.header: If two opposite equality operators ('==', '!=') are defined in a class, one shall be defined in terms of the other

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-5-5 Comparison operators shall be non-member functions with identical parameter types and noexcept
category.name: A13_5_5

rule.header: Comparison operators shall be non-member functions
Comparison operators shall be non-member functions with identical parameter types and noexcept

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-6-1 Digit sequences separators ' shall only be used as follows: (1) for decimal, every 3 digits, (2) for hexadecimal, every 2 digits, (3) for binary, every 4 digits
category.name: A13_6_1

rule.header: Digit sequences separators ' shall only be used consistently

category.description: AUTOSAR A14-5-1 A template constructor shall not participate in overload resolution for a single argument of the enclosing class type
category.name: A14_5_1

rule.header: A copy constructor shall be declared when there is a template constructor with a single parameter that is a generic parameter

category.description: AUTOSAR A14-7-2 Template specialization shall be declared in the same file (1) as the primary template (2) as a user-defined type, for which the specialization is declared
category.name: A14_7_2

rule.header: Template specialization shall be declared in the same file as the primary template or a user-defined type, for which the specialization is declared

category.description: AUTOSAR A14-8-2 Explicit specializations of function templates shall not be used
category.name: A14_8_2

rule.header: Overloaded function templates shall not be explicitly specialized

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-1-2 An exception object shall not be a pointer
category.name: A15_1_2

rule.header: An exception object should not have pointer type

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-1-5 Exceptions shall not be thrown across execution boundaries
category.name: A15_1_5

rule.header: Do not throw an exception across execution boundaries

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-2-1 Constructors that are not noexcept shall not be invoked before program startup
category.name: A15_2_1

rule.header: Function called in global or namespace scope shall not throw unhandled exceptions
Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-3-2 If a function throws an exception, it shall be handled when meaningful actions can be taken, otherwise it shall be propagated
category.name: A15_3_2

rule.header: Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-3-3 Main function and a task main function shall catch at least: base class exceptions from all third-party libraries used, std::exception and all otherwise unhandled exceptions
category.name: A15_3_3

rule.header: There should be at least one exception handler to catch all otherwise unhandled exceptions

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-3-4 Catch-all (ellipsis and std::exception) handlers shall be used only in (a) main, (b) task main functions, (c) in functions that are supposed to isolate independent components and (d) when calling third-party code that uses exceptions not according to AUTOSAR C++14 guidelines
category.name: A15_3_4

rule.header: Avoid using catch-all exception handlers

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-3-5 A class type exception shall be caught by reference or const reference
category.name: A15_3_5

rule.header: A class type exception shall always be caught by reference

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-4-1 Dynamic exception-specification shall not be used
category.name: A15_4_1

rule.header: Do not use throw exception specifications

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-4-4 A declaration of non-throwing function shall contain noexcept specification
category.name: A15_4_4

rule.header: Declare functions 'noexcept' if they will not emit exceptions

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-4-5 Checked exceptions that could be thrown from a function shall be specified together with the function declaration and they shall be identical in all function declarations and for all its overriders
category.name: A15_4_5

rule.header: Checked exceptions that could be thrown from a function shall be specified in the comment directly before the function declaration

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-5-1 All user-provided class destructors, deallocation functions, move constructors, move assignment operators and swap functions shall not exit with an exception. A noexcept exception specification shall be added to these functions as appropriate
category.name: A15_5_1

rule.header: Never allow an exception to be thrown from a destructor, deallocation, and swap
All user-provided move constructors and move assignment operators shall not exit with an exception

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-5-2 Program shall not be abruptly terminated. In particular, an implicit or explicit invocation of std::abort(), std::quick_exit(), std::_Exit(), std::terminate() shall not be done
category.name: A15_5_2

rule.header: The execution of a function registered with 'std::atexit()' or 'std::at_quick_exit()' should not exit via an exception
The 'abort()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'quick_exit()' and '_Exit()' functions from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-5-3 The std::terminate() function shall not be called implicitly
category.name: A15_5_3

rule.header: The execution of a function registered with 'std::atexit()' or 'std::at_quick_exit()' should not exit via an exception
Never allow an exception to be thrown from a destructor, deallocation, and swap
Do not throw from within destructor
There should be at least one exception handler to catch all otherwise unhandled exceptions
An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in the compound-statement of a catch handler
Exceptions shall be raised only after start-up and before termination of the program
Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point
Where a function's declaration includes an exception-specification, the function shall only be capable of throwing exceptions of the indicated type(s)
Function called in global or namespace scope shall not throw unhandled exceptions

category.description: AUTOSAR A16-0-1 The pre-processor shall only be used for unconditional and conditional file inclusion and include guards, and using the following directives: (1) #ifndef, (2) #ifdef, (3) #if, (4) #if defined, (5) #elif, (6) #else, (7) #define, (8) #endif, (9) #include
category.name: A16_0_1

rule.header: The #ifndef, #ifdef, #if, #elif, #else, and #endif pre-processor directives shall only be used for conditional file inclusion and include guards
#error directive shall not be used
The #pragma directive shall not be used
Avoid using macro definitions
#undef shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A16-2-1 The ', ", /*, //, \ characters shall not occur in a header file name or in #include directive
category.name: A16_2_1

rule.header: The following character sequences shall not appear in header file names: ', \, /*, //, or "

category.description: AUTOSAR A16-2-2 There shall be no unused include directives
category.name: A16_2_2

rule.header: A file should directly include only the headers that contain declarations and definitions required to compile that file

category.description: AUTOSAR A16-6-1 #error directive shall not be used
category.name: A16_6_1

rule.header: #error directive shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A16-7-1 The #pragma directive shall not be used
category.name: A16_7_1

rule.header: The #pragma directive shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A17-0-1 Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the C++ standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined
category.name: A17_0_1

rule.header: Do not #define nor #undef identifier 'defined'
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library, shall not be defined, redefined or undefined (C99 code)
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library, shall not be defined, redefined or undefined (C90 code)
Do not redefine reserved words
Do not #define or #undef identifiers with names which start with underscore

category.description: AUTOSAR A17-1-1 Use of the C Standard Library shall be encapsulated and isolated
category.name: A17_1_1

rule.header: The error indicator 'errno' shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A17-6-1 Non-standard entities shall not be added to standard namespaces
category.name: A17_6_1

rule.header: Do not modify the standard namespaces 'std' and 'posix'

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-0-1 The C library facilities shall only be accessed through C++ library headers
category.name: A18_0_1

rule.header: The C library shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-0-2 The error state of a conversion from string to a numeric value shall be checked
category.name: A18_0_2

rule.header: The library functions atof, atoi and atol from library stdlib.h shall not be used
The library functions atof, atoi and atol from library stdlib.h shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-0-3 The library <clocale> (locale.h) and the setlocale function shall not be used
category.name: A18_0_3

rule.header: Do not include <locale.h> header
Do not use 'setlocale' function

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-1-1 C-style arrays shall not be used
category.name: A18_1_1

rule.header: C-style arrays shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-1-2 The std::vector<bool> specialization shall not be used
category.name: A18_1_2

rule.header: Avoid using vector<bool>

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-1-3 The std::auto_ptr type shall not be used
category.name: A18_1_3

rule.header: Prefer to use std::unique_ptr instead of std::auto_ptr

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-1-6 All std::hash specializations for user-defined types shall have a noexcept function call operator
category.name: A18_1_6

rule.header: All std::hash specializations for user-defined types shall have a noexcept function call operator

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-1 Functions malloc, calloc, realloc and free shall not be used
category.name: A18_5_1

rule.header: Do not use calloc, malloc, realloc and free functions

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-10 Placement new shall be used only with properly aligned pointers to sufficient storage capacity
category.name: A18_5_10

rule.header: Do not pass a pointer that has insufficient storage capacity or that is not suitably aligned for the object being constructed to placement 'new'
An overhead should be used when an array of objects is passed to the placement 'new' allocation function

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-11 "operator new" and "operator delete" shall be defined together
category.name: A18_5_11

rule.header: Write operator delete if you write operator new
Write operator delete[] if you write operator new[]

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-2 Non-placement new or delete expressions shall not be used
category.name: A18_5_2

rule.header: Dynamic heap memory allocation shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-3 The form of the delete expression shall match the form of the new expression used to allocate the memory
category.name: A18_5_3

rule.header: Never provide brackets ([]) for delete when deallocating non-arrays
Always provide empty brackets ([]) for delete when deallocating arrays

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-4 If a project has sized or unsized version of operator "delete" globally defined, then both sized and unsized versions shall be defined
category.name: A18_5_4

rule.header: Define both sized and unsized versions of operator delete

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-5 Memory management functions shall ensure the following: (a) deterministic behavior resulting with the existence of worst-case execution time, (b) avoiding memory fragmentation, (c) avoid running out of memory, (d) avoiding mismatched allocations or deallocations, (e) no dependence on non-deterministic calls to kernel
category.name: A18_5_5

rule.header: Use the same form in corresponding calls to new/malloc and delete/free
Freed memory shouldn't be accessed under any circumstances

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-8 Objects that do not outlive a function shall have automatic storage duration
category.name: A18_5_8

rule.header: Use allocation by declaration rather than by new or malloc

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-5-9 Custom implementations of dynamic memory allocation and deallocation functions shall meet the semantic requirements specified in the corresponding "Required behaviour" clause from the C++ Standard
category.name: A18_5_9

rule.header: The user defined 'new' operator should throw the 'std::bad_alloc' exception when the allocation fails

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-9-1 The std::bind shall not be used
category.name: A18_9_1

rule.header: Prefer lambdas over std::bind, std::bind1st and std::bind2nd

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-9-2 Forwarding values to other functions shall be done via: (1) std::move if the value is an rvalue reference, (2) std::forward if the value is forwarding reference
category.name: A18_9_2

rule.header: The 'std::forward' function shall be used to forward universal references

category.description: AUTOSAR A18-9-3 The std::move shall not be used on objects declared const or const&
category.name: A18_9_3

rule.header: Do not use std::move on objects declared with the const or const & type

category.description: AUTOSAR A1-1-1 All code shall conform to ISO/IEC 14882:2014 - Programming Language C++ and shall not use deprecated features
category.name: A1_1_1

rule.header: The 'register' storage class specifier shall not be used
A copy assignment operator should be declared when a copy constructor is declared (and vice versa)
Both copy constructor and copy assignment operator should be declared for classes with a nontrivial destructor
The C library shall not be used
Prefer lambdas over std::bind, std::bind1st and std::bind2nd
The 'binder1st' and 'binder2nd' identifiers should not be used
Prefer to use std::unique_ptr instead of std::auto_ptr
The 'random_shuffle' identifier should not be used
Do not use the increment operator (++) on an operand of type 'bool'
The 'set_unexpected' identifier should not be used
Do not use throw exception specifications

category.description: AUTOSAR A20-8-2 A std::unique_ptr shall be used to represent exclusive ownership
category.name: A20_8_2

rule.header: Use smart pointers when passing a pointer to an object in a thread

category.description: AUTOSAR A20-8-3 A std::shared_ptr shall be used to represent shared ownership
category.name: A20_8_3

rule.header: Use smart pointers when passing a pointer to an object in a thread

category.description: AUTOSAR A20-8-4 A std::unique_ptr shall be used over std::shared_ptr if ownership sharing is not required
category.name: A20_8_4

rule.header: Consider using 'std::unique_ptr' instead of 'std::shared_ptr' for local objects

category.description: AUTOSAR A20-8-5 std::make_unique shall be used to construct objects owned by std::unique_ptr
category.name: A20_8_5

rule.header: 'std::make_unique' shall be used to construct objects owned by 'std::unique_ptr'

category.description: AUTOSAR A20-8-6 std::make_shared shall be used to construct objects owned by std::shared_ptr
category.name: A20_8_6

rule.header: Prefer 'std::make_shared' to the direct use of new

category.description: AUTOSAR A23-0-1 An iterator shall not be implicitly converted to const_iterator
category.name: A23_0_1

rule.header: Use const container calls when the result is immediately converted to a const iterator

category.description: AUTOSAR A25-1-1 Non-static data members or captured values of predicate function objects that are state related to this object's identity shall not be copied
category.name: A25_1_1

rule.header: Make predicates const pure functions

category.description: AUTOSAR A25-4-1 Ordering predicates used with associative containers and STL sorting and related algorithms shall adhere to a strict weak ordering relation
category.name: A25_4_1

rule.header: For associative containers never use comparison function returning true for equal values

category.description: AUTOSAR A26-5-1 Pseudorandom numbers shall not be generated using std::rand()
category.name: A26_5_1

rule.header: Do not use the rand() function for generating pseudorandom numbers

category.description: AUTOSAR A27-0-1 Inputs from independent components shall be validated
category.name: A27_0_1

rule.header: Avoid calling functions printf/wprintf with only one argument other than string constant

category.description: AUTOSAR A27-0-2 A C-style string shall guarantee sufficient space for data and the null terminator
category.name: A27_0_2

rule.header: Do not use the 'char' buffer to store input from 'std::cin'

category.description: AUTOSAR A27-0-4 C-style strings shall not be used
category.name: A27_0_4

rule.header: Don't use unsafe C functions that do write to range-unchecked buffers
Avoid using unsafe string functions that do not check bounds
Do not use the 'char' buffer to store input from 'std::cin'
C-style strings shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-10-1 An identifier declared in an inner scope shall not hide an identifier declared in an outer scope
category.name: A2_10_1

rule.header: Identifier declared in a local or function prototype scope shall not hide an identifier declared in a global or namespace scope
Identifiers declared in an inner local scope should not hide identifiers declared in an outer local scope
Identifiers declared in a local scope should not hide identifiers declared in a class scope
Identifiers declared in a class scope should not hide identifiers declared in a global or namespace scope
Identifiers declared in an inner class scope should not hide identifiers declared in outer class scope

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-10-6 A class or enumeration name shall not be hidden by a variable, function or enumerator declaration in the same scope
category.name: A2_10_6

rule.header: If an identifier refers to a type, it shall not also refer to an object or a function in the same scope
If an identifier refers to a type, it shall not also refer to an object or a function in the same scope
If an identifier refers to a type, it shall not also refer to an object or a function in the same scope

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-11-1 Volatile keyword shall not be used
category.name: A2_11_1

rule.header: Do not use the volatile keyword

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-13-1 Only those escape sequences that are defined in ISO/IEC 14882:2014 shall be used
category.name: A2_13_1

rule.header: Only those escape sequences that are defined in ISO/IEC 14882:2014 shall be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-13-2 String literals with different encoding prefixes shall not be concatenated
category.name: A2_13_2

rule.header: String literals with different encoding prefixes shall not be concatenated

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-13-3 Type wchar_t shall not be used
category.name: A2_13_3

rule.header: Type wchar_t shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-13-4 String literals shall not be assigned to non-constant pointers
category.name: A2_13_4

rule.header: A string literal shall not be modified

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-13-6 Universal character names shall be used only inside character or string literals
category.name: A2_13_6

rule.header: Universal character names shall be used only inside character or string literals

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-3-1 Only those characters specified in the C++ Language Standard basic source character set shall be used in the source code
category.name: A2_3_1

rule.header: Only use characters defined in the ISO C standard

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-5-1 Trigraphs shall not be used
category.name: A2_5_1

rule.header: Trigraphs shall not be used
Trigraphs shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-5-2 Digraphs shall not be used
category.name: A2_5_2

rule.header: Do not use the following digraphs: <%, %>, <:, :>, %:, %:%:

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-7-1 The character \ shall not occur as a last character of a C++ comment
category.name: A2_7_1

rule.header: Line-splicing shall not be used in // comments

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-7-2 Sections of code shall not be "commented out"
category.name: A2_7_2

rule.header: Sections of code should not be "commented out"

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-7-3 All declarations of "user-defined" types, static and non-static data members, functions and methods shall be preceded by documentation using "///" comments and "@tag" tags
category.name: A2_7_3

rule.header: All declarations of types, data members, and functions should be preceded by a comment annotated with the '@brief' tag
Function parameters and return type should be documented in a comment that precedes the function declaration

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-8-1 A header file name shall be identical to a type name declared in it if it declares a type
category.name: A2_8_1

rule.header: An include file for a class should have a file name of the form <class name> + extension

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-1-1 It shall be possible to include any header file in multiple translation units without violating the One Definition Rule
category.name: A3_1_1

rule.header: Don't define entities with linkage in a header file

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-1-2 Header files, that are defined locally in the project, shall have a file name extension of one of: ".h", ".hpp" or ".hxx"
category.name: A3_1_2

rule.header: Header files should have a file extension of: ".h", ".hpp" or ".hxx"

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-1-4 When an array with external linkage is declared, its size shall be stated explicitly
category.name: A3_1_4

rule.header: When an array is declared with external linkage, its size shall be stated explicitly or defined implicitly by initialisation

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-1-5 A function definition shall only be placed in a class definition if (1) the function is intended to be inlined (2) it is a member function template (3) it is a member function of a class template
category.name: A3_1_5

rule.header: A function definition should not be placed in a class specification unless the function is intended to be inlined

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-3-1 Objects or functions with external linkage (including members of named namespaces) shall be declared in a header file
category.name: A3_3_1

rule.header: Objects or functions with external linkage shall be declared in a header file
Don't define entities with linkage in a header file

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-3-2 Static and thread-local objects shall be constant-initialized
category.name: A3_3_2

rule.header: Static and thread-local objects shall be constant-initialized

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-8-1 An object shall not be accessed outside of its lifetime
category.name: A3_8_1

rule.header: The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be returned from a function
The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to another object that may persist after the first object has ceased to exist

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-9-1 Fixed width integer types from <cstdint>, indicating the size and signedness, shall be used in place of the basic numerical types
category.name: A3_9_1

rule.header: Fixed width integer types from <cstdint>, indicating the size and signedness, shall be used in place of the basic numerical types
A typedef should be used in place of the plain char type

category.description: AUTOSAR A4-10-1 Only nullptr literal shall be used as the null-pointer-constant
category.name: A4_10_1

rule.header: NULL shall not be used as an integer value
Prefer 'nullptr' over 'NULL' or '0'(zero)

category.description: AUTOSAR A4-5-1 Expressions with type enum or enum class shall not be used as operands to built-in and overloaded operators other than the subscript operator [ ], the assignment operator =, the equality operators == and !=, the unary & operator, and the relational operators <, <=, >, >=
category.name: A4_5_1

rule.header: Expressions with type enum shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than [ ], =, ==, !=, <, <=, >, >=, and the unary & operator

category.description: AUTOSAR A4-7-1 An integer expression shall not lead to data loss
category.name: A4_7_1

rule.header: Avoid implicit conversions from signed to unsigned type
Implicit conversions from integral constant to floating type which may result in a loss of information shall not be used
Avoid conversions of constant values to a narrower type
Implicit conversions from wider to narrower integral type which may result in a loss of information shall not be used
Avoid implicit conversions from wider to narrower floating type
Avoid implicit conversions from floating to integral type
Implicit conversions from integral to floating type which may result in a loss of information shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-0-1 The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
category.name: A5_0_1

rule.header: Don't write code that depends on the order of evaluation of function calls
Do not use more than one volatile between two adjacent sequence points
Between sequence points an object shall have its stored value modified at most once by the evaluation of an expression
Don't write code that depends on the order of evaluation of expression that involves a function call
Don't write code that depends on the order of evaluation of function designator and function arguments
Don't write code that depends on the order of evaluation of function arguments
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-0-2 The condition of an if-statement and the condition of an iteration statement shall have type bool
category.name: A5_0_2

rule.header: The condition of an if-statement and the condition of an iteration-statement shall have type bool

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-0-3 The declaration of objects shall contain no more than two levels of pointer indirection
category.name: A5_0_3

rule.header: The declaration of objects should contain no more than 2 levels of pointer indirection

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-0-4 Pointer arithmetic shall not be used with pointers to non-final classes
category.name: A5_0_4

rule.header: Don't treat arrays polymorphically
A pointer to an array of derived class objects should not be converted to a base class pointer

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-10-1 A pointer to member virtual function shall only be tested for equality with null-pointer-constant
category.name: A5_10_1

rule.header: A pointer to member virtual function shall only be tested for equality with null-pointer-constant

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-16-1 The ternary conditional operator shall not be used as a sub-expression
category.name: A5_16_1

rule.header: The conditional operator should not be used as a sub-expression

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-1-1 Literal values shall not be used apart from type initialization, otherwise symbolic names shall be used instead
category.name: A5_1_1

rule.header: Avoid magic numbers

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-1-2 Variables shall not be implicitly captured in a lambda expression
category.name: A5_1_2

rule.header: Avoid default capture modes

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-1-3 Parameter list (possibly empty) shall be included in every lambda expression
category.name: A5_1_3

rule.header: Include a parameter list in every lambda expression

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-1-4 A lambda expression object shall not outlive any of its reference-captured objects
category.name: A5_1_4

rule.header: Never return lambdas that capture local objects by reference
Never capture local objects from an outer lambda by reference
The lambda that captures local objects by reference should not be assigned to the variable with a greater lifetime

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-1-7 A lambda shall not be an operand to decltype or typeid
category.name: A5_1_7

rule.header: A lambda shall not be an operand to typeid

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-2-2 Traditional C-style casts shall not be used
category.name: A5_2_2

rule.header: C-style casts should not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-2-3 A cast shall not remove any const or volatile qualification from the type of a pointer or reference
category.name: A5_2_3

rule.header: A cast shall not remove any 'const' or 'volatile' qualification from the type of a pointer or reference

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-2-4 reinterpret_cast shall not be used
category.name: A5_2_4

rule.header: Avoid using reinterpret_cast

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-2-6 The operands of a logical && or || shall be parenthesized if the operands contain binary operators
category.name: A5_2_6

rule.header: The operands of a logical && or || shall be parenthesized if the operands contain binary operators

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-3-1 Evaluation of the operand to the typeid operator shall not contain side effects
category.name: A5_3_1

rule.header: The operand of the 'typeid' operator shall not contain any expression that has side effects
The operand of the 'typeid' operator shall not contain a function call that causes side effects

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-3-3 Pointers to incomplete class types shall not be deleted
category.name: A5_3_3

rule.header: Do not delete objects with incomplete class at the point of deletion

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-5-1 A pointer to member shall not access non-existent class members
category.name: A5_5_1

rule.header: A cast shall not convert a pointer to a function to any other pointer type, including a pointer to function type

category.description: AUTOSAR A6-2-1 Move and copy assignment operators shall either move or respectively copy base classes and data members of a class, without any side effects
category.name: A6_2_1

rule.header: Copy assignment operators should not have side effects that could affect copying the object
Move assignment operators should not have side effects that could affect moving the object

category.description: AUTOSAR A6-2-2 Expression statements shall not be explicit calls to constructors of temporary objects only
category.name: A6_2_2

rule.header: Expression statements shall not be explicit calls to constructors of temporary objects only

category.description: AUTOSAR A6-4-1 A switch statement shall have at least two case-clauses, distinct from the default label
category.name: A6_4_1

rule.header: Every switch statement will have at least two cases and a potential default

category.description: AUTOSAR A6-5-1 A for-loop that loops through all elements of the container and does not use its loop-counter shall not be used
category.name: A6_5_1

rule.header: A for-loop that loops through all elements of the container and does not use its loop-counter shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A6-5-2 A for loop shall contain a single loop-counter which shall not have floating-point type
category.name: A6_5_2

rule.header: A for loop shall contain a single loop-counter which shall not have floating type

category.description: AUTOSAR A6-6-1 The goto statement shall not be used
category.name: A6_6_1

rule.header: The goto statement shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-1 Constexpr or const specifiers shall be used for immutable data declaration
category.name: A7_1_1

rule.header: Declare local variable as const whenever possible
Declare parameters as const whenever possible

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-2 The constexpr specifier shall be used for values that can be determined at compile time
category.name: A7_1_2

rule.header: Use constexpr to declare const variables whenever possible
Use constexpr to declare functions whenever possible

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-3 CV-qualifiers shall be placed on the right hand side of the type that is a typedef or a using name
category.name: A7_1_3

rule.header: CV-qualifiers shall be placed on the right hand side of the type that is a typedef or a using name

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-4 The register keyword shall not be used
category.name: A7_1_4

rule.header: The 'register' storage class specifier shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-5 The auto specifier shall not be used apart from following cases: (1) to declare that a variable has the same type as return type of a function call, (2) to declare that a variable has the same type as initializer of non-fundamental type, (3) to declare parameters of a generic lambda expression, (4) to declare a function template using trailing return type syntax
category.name: A7_1_5

rule.header: Do not overuse 'auto' specifier

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-6 The typedef specifier shall not be used
category.name: A7_1_6

rule.header: Prefer alias declarations to typedefs

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-7 Each expression statement and identifier declaration shall be placed on a separate line
category.name: A7_1_7

rule.header: Only one statement shall be allowed per line
Multiple variable declarations shall not be allowed on the same line
Each variable should be declared in a separate declaration statement

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-8 A non-type specifier shall be placed before a type specifier in a declaration
category.name: A7_1_8

rule.header: Do not place type specifiers before non-type specifiers in a declaration

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-1-9 A class, structure, or enumeration shall not be declared in the definition of its type
category.name: A7_1_9

rule.header: A class, structure, or enumeration will not be declared in the definition of its type

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-2-1 An expression with enum underlying type shall only have values corresponding to the enumerators of the enumeration
category.name: A7_2_1

rule.header: An expression with enum underlying type shall only have values corresponding to the enumerators of the enumeration

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-2-2 Enumeration underlying base type shall be explicitly defined
category.name: A7_2_2

rule.header: Use an explicit enumeration base and ensure that it is large enough to store all enumerators

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-2-3 Enumerations shall be declared as scoped enum classes
category.name: A7_2_3

rule.header: Prefer Scoped Enums to Unscoped Enums

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-2-4 In an enumeration, either (1) none, (2) the first or (3) all enumerators shall be initialized
category.name: A7_2_4

rule.header: In an enumerator list, the "=" construct shall not be used to explicitly initialise members other than the first, unless all items are explicitly initialised

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-3-1 All overloads of a function shall be visible from where it is called
category.name: A7_3_1

rule.header: Member functions declared in derived class should not hide functions declared in base classes

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-4-1 The asm declaration shall not be used
category.name: A7_4_1

rule.header: Do not use the asm declaration

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-5-1 A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by reference to const
category.name: A7_5_1

rule.header: A function shall not return a pointer or a reference to a parameter that is passed by const reference

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-5-2 Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly
category.name: A7_5_2

rule.header: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-2-1 When declaring function templates, the trailing return type syntax shall be used if the return type depends on the type of parameters
category.name: A8_2_1

rule.header: Use a trailing return type syntax if the return type is preceded by the 'typename' keyword

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-1 Functions shall not be defined using the ellipsis notation
category.name: A8_4_1

rule.header: Do not use functions with variable numbers of arguments

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-11 A smart pointer shall only be used as a parameter type if it expresses lifetime semantics
category.name: A8_4_11

rule.header: A smart pointer shall only be used as a parameter type if it expresses lifetime semantics

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-12 A std::unique_ptr shall be passed to a function as: (1) a copy to express the function assumes ownership (2) an lvalue reference to express that the function replaces the managed object
category.name: A8_4_12

rule.header: Do not pass std::unique_ptr by const reference
A smart pointer shall only be used as a parameter type if it expresses lifetime semantics
A parameter should only be declared as a non-const lvalue reference to 'std::shared_ptr' or 'std::unique_ptr' if the function replaces the managed object
Do not declare the type of a parameter as an rvalue reference to 'std::shared_ptr' or 'std::unique_ptr'

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-13 A std::shared_ptr shall be passed to a function as: (1) a copy to express the function shares ownership (2) an lvalue reference to express that the function replaces the managed object (3) a const lvalue reference to express that the function retains a reference count
category.name: A8_4_13

rule.header: A smart pointer shall only be used as a parameter type if it expresses lifetime semantics
A parameter should only be declared as a non-const lvalue reference to 'std::shared_ptr' or 'std::unique_ptr' if the function replaces the managed object
Do not declare the type of a parameter as an rvalue reference to 'std::shared_ptr' or 'std::unique_ptr'

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-2 All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression
category.name: A8_4_2

rule.header: All exit paths from a function, except main(), with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-5 "consume" parameters declared as X && shall always be moved from
category.name: A8_4_5

rule.header: Use std::move() on rvalue references and std::forward() on forwarding references

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-6 "forward" parameters declared as T && shall always be forwarded
category.name: A8_4_6

rule.header: Use std::move() on rvalue references and std::forward() on forwarding references

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-7 "in" parameters for "cheap to copy" types shall be passed by value
category.name: A8_4_7

rule.header: A parameter of const reference to a 'cheap to copy' type should be passed by value

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-8 Output parameters shall not be used
category.name: A8_4_8

rule.header: Output parameters shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-9 "in-out" parameters declared as T & shall be modified
category.name: A8_4_9

rule.header: Declare reference parameters as const references whenever possible

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-5-1 In an initialization list, the order of initialization shall be following: (1) virtual base classes in depth and left to right order of the inheritance graph, (2) direct base classes in left to right order of inheritance list, (3) non-static data members in the order they were declared in the class definition
category.name: A8_5_1

rule.header: List members in an initialization list in the order in which they are declared

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-5-2 Braced-initialization {}, without equals sign, shall be used for variable initialization
category.name: A8_5_2

rule.header: Braced-initialization {}, without equals sign, shall be used for variable initialization

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-5-3 A variable of type auto shall not be initialized using {} or ={} braced-initialization
category.name: A8_5_3

rule.header: A variable of type auto shall not be initialized using '{}' or '={}' braced-initialization

category.description: AUTOSAR A9-3-1 Member functions shall not return non-const "raw" pointers or references to private or protected data owned by the class
category.name: A9_3_1

rule.header: Public member functions shall not return non-const handles to private/protected class-data
Protected member function shall not return non-const handles to private class-data

category.description: AUTOSAR A9-5-1 Unions shall not be used
category.name: A9_5_1

rule.header: Unions shall not be used
Unions shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR A9-6-1 Data types used for interfacing with hardware or conforming to communication protocols shall be trivial, standard-layout and only contain members of types with defined sizes
category.name: A9_6_1

rule.header: Bit fields shall only be defined to be of type unsigned int or signed int

category.description: AUTOSAR A9-6-2 Bit-fields shall be used only when interfacing to hardware or conforming to communication protocols
category.name: A9_6_2

rule.header: Do not declare member variables as bit-fields

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-1-1 A project shall not contain unreachable code
category.name: M0_1_1

rule.header: There shall be no unreachable code in "if/else/while/for" block
There shall be no unreachable code after 'return', 'break', 'continue', and 'goto' statements
There shall be no unreachable code in "else" block
There shall be no unreachable code after "if" or "switch" statement inside while/for/do...while loop
There shall be no unreachable code after 'if' or 'switch' statement
There shall be no unreachable code in 'for' loop
There shall be no unreachable code in switch statement

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-1-2 A project shall not contain infeasible paths
category.name: M0_1_2

rule.header: Boolean operations whose results are invariant shall not be permitted
Boolean operations whose results are invariant shall not be permitted

Boolean operations whose results are invariant shall not be permitted

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-1-3 A project shall not contain unused variables
category.name: M0_1_3

rule.header: Avoid unused local variables
Avoid unnecessary local variables
Avoid unused private member variables
A project should not contain unused variables with internal linkage

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-1-8 All functions with void return type shall have external side effect(s)
category.name: M0_1_8

rule.header: All non-empty functions with void return type shall have external side effect(s)
Functions with void return type shall not be empty

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-1-9 There shall be no dead code
category.name: M0_1_9

rule.header: All non-null statements shall either have at least one side-effect however executed or cause control flow to change

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-2-1 An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object
category.name: M0_2_1

rule.header: An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object
An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-3-2 If a function generates error information, then that error information shall be tested
category.name: M0_3_2

rule.header: If a function returns error information, then that error information shall be tested

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-4-2 Use of floating-point arithmetic shall be documented
category.name: M0_4_2

rule.header: Use of floating-point arithmetic shall be documented

category.description: AUTOSAR M10-1-3 An accessible base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy
category.name: M10_1_3

rule.header: A base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy

category.description: AUTOSAR M10-3-3 A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual
category.name: M10_3_3

rule.header: A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual

category.description: AUTOSAR M11-0-1 Member data in non-POD class types shall be private
category.name: M11_0_1

rule.header: Member data in non-POD types shall be private

category.description: AUTOSAR M14-5-3 A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is a generic parameter
category.name: M14_5_3

rule.header: A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is a generic parameter

category.description: AUTOSAR M14-6-1 In a class template with a dependent base, any name that may be found in that dependent base shall be referred to using a qualified-id or this->
category.name: M14_6_1

rule.header: In a class template with a dependent base, any name that may be found in that dependent base shall be referred to using a qualified-id or this->

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-0-3 Control shall not be transferred into a try or catch block using a goto or a switch statement
category.name: M15_0_3

rule.header: Control shall not be transferred into a try or catch block using a goto or a switch statement

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-1-1 The assignment-expression of a throw statement shall not itself cause an exception to be thrown
category.name: M15_1_1

rule.header: The assignment-expression of a throw statement shall not itself cause an exception to be thrown

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-1-2 NULL shall not be thrown explicitly
category.name: M15_1_2

rule.header: NULL shall not be thrown explicitly

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-1-3 An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in the compound statement of a catch handler
category.name: M15_1_3

rule.header: An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in the compound-statement of a catch handler

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-3-1 Exceptions shall be raised only after start-up and before termination
category.name: M15_3_1

rule.header: Exceptions shall be raised only after start-up and before termination of the program

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-3-3 Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor or destructor shall not reference non-static members from this class or its bases
category.name: M15_3_3

rule.header: Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor or destructor shall not reference nonstatic members from this class or its bases

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-3-4 Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point
category.name: M15_3_4

rule.header: Function called in global or namespace scope shall not throw unhandled exceptions
Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-3-6 Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block for a derived class and some or all of its bases, the handlers shall be ordered most-derived to base class
category.name: M15_3_6

rule.header: Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block for a derived class and some or all of its bases, the handlers shall be ordered most-derived to base class

category.description: AUTOSAR M15-3-7 Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block, any ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur last
category.name: M15_3_7

rule.header: Where multiple handlers are provided in a single 'try-catch' statement or 'function-try-block', any ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur last

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-0-1 #include directives in a file shall only be preceded by other pre-processor directives or comments
category.name: M16_0_1

rule.header: #include statements in a file should only be preceded by other preprocessor directives or comments

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-0-2 Macros shall only be #define'd or #undef'd in the global namespace
category.name: M16_0_2

rule.header: Macros shall not be #define'd or #undef'd within a block

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-0-5 Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like pre-processing directives
category.name: M16_0_5

rule.header: Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like preprocessing directives

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-0-6 In the definition of a function-like macro, each instance of a parameter shall be enclosed in parentheses, unless it is used as the operand of # or ##
category.name: M16_0_6

rule.header: In the definition of a function-like macro each instance of a parameter shall be enclosed in parentheses unless it is used as the operand of # or ##

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-0-7 Undefined macro identifiers shall not be used in #if or #elif pre-processor directives, except as operands to the defined operator
category.name: M16_0_7

rule.header: Do not use in preprocessor directives #if and #elif macros not defined in translation unit

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-0-8 If the # token appears as the first token on a line, then it shall be immediately followed by a pre-processing token
category.name: M16_0_8

rule.header: Preprocessing directives shall be syntactically meaningful even when excluded by the preprocessor

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-1-1 The defined pre-processor operator shall only be used in one of the two standard forms
category.name: M16_1_1

rule.header: The defined preprocessor operator shall only be used in one of the two standard forms

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-1-2 All #else, #elif and #endif pre-processor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if or #ifdef directive to which they are related
category.name: M16_1_2

rule.header: All #else, #elif and #endif preprocessor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if or #ifdef directive to which they are related

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-2-3 Include guards shall be provided
category.name: M16_2_3

rule.header: Use multiple include guards

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-3-1 There shall be at most one occurrence of the # or ## operators in a single macro definition
category.name: M16_3_1

rule.header: There shall be at most one occurrence of the # or ## preprocessor operators in a single macro definition

category.description: AUTOSAR M17-0-2 The names of standard library macros and objects shall not be reused
category.name: M17_0_2

rule.header: The names of standard library macros and objects shall not be reused

category.description: AUTOSAR M17-0-3 The names of standard library functions shall not be overridden
category.name: M17_0_3

rule.header: The names of standard library functions shall not be overridden

category.description: AUTOSAR M17-0-5 The setjmp macro and the longjmp function shall not be used
category.name: M17_0_5

rule.header: The facilities provided by <setjmp.h> should not be used
The standard header files <setjmp.h> or <csetjmp> shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M18-0-3 The library functions abort, exit, getenv and system from library <cstdlib> shall not be used
category.name: M18_0_3

rule.header: The 'abort()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'exit()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'system()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used
The 'getenv()' function from the 'stdlib.h' or 'cstdlib' library shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M18-0-4 The time handling functions of library <ctime> shall not be used
category.name: M18_0_4

rule.header: The standard header files <time.h> or <ctime> shall not be used
The time handling functions and macros of the library <time.h> shall not be used
The types defined in the library <time.h> shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M18-0-5 The unbounded functions of library <cstring> shall not be used
category.name: M18_0_5

rule.header: The unbounded functions of library <cstring> shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M18-2-1 The macro offsetof shall not be used
category.name: M18_2_1

rule.header: The macro offsetof, in library stddef.h, shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M18-7-1 The signal handling facilities of <csignal> shall not be used
category.name: M18_7_1

rule.header: The signal handling facilities of <signal.h> shall not be used
The standard header files <signal.h> or <csignal> shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M19-3-1 The error indicator errno shall not be used
category.name: M19_3_1

rule.header: The error indicator 'errno' shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M27-0-1 The stream input/output library <cstdio> shall not be used
category.name: M27_0_1

rule.header: The input/output library stdio.h shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M2-10-1 Different identifiers shall be typographically unambiguous
category.name: M2_10_1
