rule.header: Different identifiers shall be typographically unambiguous

category.description: AUTOSAR M2-13-2 Octal constants (other than zero) and octal escape sequences (other than "\0" ) shall not be used
category.name: M2_13_2

rule.header: Octal constants (other than zero) shall not be used
Octal escape sequences shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M2-13-3 A "U" suffix shall be applied to all octal or hexadecimal integer literals of unsigned type
category.name: M2_13_3

rule.header: A "U" suffix shall be applied to all octal or hexadecimal integer literals of unsigned type

category.description: AUTOSAR M2-13-4 Literal suffixes shall be upper case
category.name: M2_13_4

rule.header: Literal suffixes shall use uppercase rather than lowercase letters

category.description: AUTOSAR M2-7-1 The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment
category.name: M2_7_1

rule.header: The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment

category.description: AUTOSAR M3-1-2 Functions shall not be declared at block scope
category.name: M3_1_2

rule.header: Always declare functions at file scope

category.description: AUTOSAR M3-3-2 If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class specifier
category.name: M3_3_2

rule.header: If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the 'static' storage class specifier

category.description: AUTOSAR M3-4-1 An identifier declared to be an object or type shall be defined in a block that minimizes its visibility
category.name: M3_4_1

rule.header: Declare variables as locally as possible
Objects shall be defined at block scope if they are only accessed from within a single function

category.description: AUTOSAR M3-9-1 The types used for an object, a function return type, or a function parameter shall be token-for-token identical in all declarations and re-declarations
category.name: M3_9_1

rule.header: The types used for an object, a function return type, or a function parameter shall be token-for-token identical in all declarations and re-declarations

category.description: AUTOSAR M3-9-3 The underlying bit representations of floating-point values shall not be used
category.name: M3_9_3

rule.header: The underlying bit representations of floating-point values shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M4-10-1 NULL shall not be used as an integer value
category.name: M4_10_1

rule.header: NULL shall not be used as an integer value

category.description: AUTOSAR M4-10-2 Literal zero (0) shall not be used as the null-pointer-constant
category.name: M4_10_2

rule.header: Literal zero (0) shall not be used as the null-pointer-constant

category.description: AUTOSAR M4-5-1 Expressions with type bool shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the logical operators &&, ||, !, the equality operators == and !=, the unary & operator, and the conditional operator
category.name: M4_5_1

rule.header: Expressions that are effectively Boolean should not be used as operands to operators other than (&&, ||, !, =, ==, !=, ?:)

category.description: AUTOSAR M4-5-3 Expressions with type (plain) char and wchar_t shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the equality operators == and !=, and the unary & operator
category.name: M4_5_3

rule.header: Expressions with type (plain) char and wchar_t shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than =, ==, != and the unary & operator

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-10 If the bitwise operators ~ and << are applied to an operand with an underlying type of unsigned char or unsigned short, the result shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand
category.name: M5_0_10

rule.header: If the bitwise operators ~ and << are applied to an operand of underlying type unsigned char or unsigned short, the result shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-11 The plain char type shall only be used for the storage and use of character values
category.name: M5_0_11

rule.header: The plain char type shall be used only for the storage and use of character values

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-12 Signed char and unsigned char type shall only be used for the storage and use of numeric values
category.name: M5_0_12

rule.header: signed and unsigned char type shall be used only for the storage and use of numeric values

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-14 The first operand of a conditional-operator shall have type bool
category.name: M5_0_14

rule.header: The first operand of a conditional-operator shall have type bool

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-15 Array indexing shall be the only form of pointer arithmetic
category.name: M5_0_15

rule.header: Array indexing shall be the only allowed form of pointer arithmetic

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-20 Non-constant operands to a binary bitwise operator shall have the same underlying type
category.name: M5_0_20

rule.header: Non-constant operands to a binary bitwise operator shall have the same underlying type

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-21 Bitwise operators shall only be applied to operands of unsigned underlying type
category.name: M5_0_21

rule.header: Bitwise operators shall only be applied to operands of unsigned underlying type

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-3 A cvalue expression shall not be implicitly converted to a different underlying type
category.name: M5_0_3

rule.header: Avoid implicit conversions of complex expressions
Avoid implicit conversions of complex expressions
Avoid implicit conversions of complex expressions

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-4 An implicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type
category.name: M5_0_4

rule.header: Avoid implicit conversions between signed and unsigned integer types

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-5 There shall be no implicit floating-integral conversions
category.name: M5_0_5

rule.header: There shall be no implicit conversions from integral to floating type
Avoid implicit conversions from floating to integral type

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-6 An implicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not reduce the size of the underlying type
category.name: M5_0_6

rule.header: Avoid implicit integral conversions from a wider to a narrower type
Avoid implicit conversions from wider to narrower floating type
Avoid implicit conversions of floating point numbers from wider to narrower floating type

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-7 There shall be no explicit floating-integral conversions of a cvalue expression
category.name: M5_0_7

rule.header: The value of a complex expression of floating type should not be cast to an integer type
The value of a complex expression of integer type shall only be cast to a type of the same signedness that is no wider than the underlying type of the expression

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-8 An explicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not increase the size of the underlying type of a cvalue expression
category.name: M5_0_8

rule.header: The value of a complex expression of integer type shall only be cast to a type of the same signedness that is no wider than the underlying type of the expression
The value of a complex expression of floating type should not be cast to a wider floating type

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-9 An explicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type of a cvalue expression
category.name: M5_0_9

rule.header: The value of a complex expression of integer type shall only be cast to a type of the same signedness that is no wider than the underlying type of the expression

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-14-1 The right hand operand of a logical &&, || operators shall not contain side effects
category.name: M5_14_1

rule.header: The right-hand operand of a logical && or || operator shall not contain side effects

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-17-1 The semantic equivalence between a binary operator and its assignment operator form shall be preserved
category.name: M5_17_1

rule.header: The overloaded binary operator should be implemented in terms of its corresponding compound assignment operator

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-18-1 The comma operator shall not be used
category.name: M5_18_1

rule.header: The comma operator shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-19-1 Evaluation of constant unsigned integer expressions shall not lead to wrap-around
category.name: M5_19_1

rule.header: Integer overflow or underflow in constant expression in '<<' operator
Integer overflow or underflow in constant expression in '+', '-', '*' operator

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-2-10 The increment (++) and decrement (--) operators shall not be mixed with other operators in an expression
category.name: M5_2_10

rule.header: The increment (++) and decrement (--) operators should not be mixed with arithmetic operators in an expression

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-2-11 The comma operator, && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded
category.name: M5_2_11

rule.header: Avoid overloading comma operator ","
Avoid overloading logical operators AND, OR (&&, ||)

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-2-12 An identifier with array type passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer
category.name: M5_2_12

rule.header: An identifier with array type passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-2-2 A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast
category.name: M5_2_2

rule.header: A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-2-6 A cast shall not convert a pointer to a function to any other pointer type, including a pointer to function type
category.name: M5_2_6

rule.header: A cast shall not convert a pointer to a function to any other pointer type, including a pointer to function type

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-2-8 An object with integer type or pointer to void type shall not be converted to an object with pointer type
category.name: M5_2_8

rule.header: An object with integer type or pointer to void type shall not be converted to an object with pointer type

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-2-9 A cast shall not convert a pointer type to an integral type
category.name: M5_2_9

rule.header: A cast should not convert a pointer type to an integral type

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-3-1 Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool
category.name: M5_3_1

rule.header: Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-3-2 The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned
category.name: M5_3_2

rule.header: The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-3-3 The unary & operator shall not be overloaded
category.name: M5_3_3

rule.header: The unary & operator shall not be overloaded

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-3-4 Evaluation of the operand to the sizeof operator shall not contain side effects
category.name: M5_3_4

rule.header: The operand of the sizeof operator shall not contain any expression which has side effects
Object designated by a volatile lvalue should not be accessed in the operand of the sizeof operator
The function call that causes the side effect shall not be the operand of the sizeof operator

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-8-1 The right hand operand of a shift operator shall lie between zero and one less than the width in bits of the underlying type of the left hand operand
category.name: M5_8_1

rule.header: The right-hand operand of a shift operator shall lie between zero and one less than the width in bits of the underlying type of the left-hand operand

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-2-1 Assignment operators shall not be used in sub-expressions
category.name: M6_2_1

rule.header: Assignment operators shall not be used in expressions that yield a Boolean value

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-2-2 Floating-point expressions shall not be directly or indirectly tested for equality or inequality
category.name: M6_2_2

rule.header: Floating-point expressions shall not be tested for equality or inequality

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-2-3 Before preprocessing, a null statement shall only occur on a line by itself; it may be followed by a comment, provided that the first character following the null statement is a white-space character
category.name: M6_2_3

rule.header: A null statement shall occur on a line by itself or be followed by a comment

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-3-1 The statement forming the body of a switch, while, do ... while or for statement shall be a compound statement
category.name: M6_3_1

rule.header: The statement forming the body of a 'switch', 'while', 'do...while' or 'for' statement shall be a compound statement

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-4-1 An if ( condition ) construct shall be followed by a compound statement. The else keyword shall be followed by either a compound statement, or another if statement
category.name: M6_4_1

rule.header: 'if' and 'else' should be followed by a compound statement

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-4-2 All if ... else if constructs shall be terminated with an else clause
category.name: M6_4_2

rule.header: All 'if...else-if' constructs shall be terminated with an 'else' clause

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-4-3 A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement
category.name: M6_4_3

rule.header: An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause
The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause unless all enumeration values are tested
A switch label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement
Every switch statement shall have at least one case clause
A switch expression shall not represent a value that is effectively Boolean

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-4-4 A switch-label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement
category.name: M6_4_4

rule.header: A switch label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-4-5 An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause
category.name: M6_4_5

rule.header: An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-4-6 The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause
category.name: M6_4_6

rule.header: The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause unless all enumeration values are tested

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-4-7 The condition of a switch statement shall not have bool type
category.name: M6_4_7

rule.header: A switch expression shall not represent a value that is effectively Boolean

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-5-2 If loop-counter is not modified by -- or ++, then, within condition, the loop-counter shall only be used as an operand to <=, <, > or >=
category.name: M6_5_2

rule.header: If loop-counter is not modified by -- or ++, then, within condition, the loop-counter shall only be used as an operand to <=, <, > or >=

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-5-3 The loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or statement
category.name: M6_5_3

rule.header: Do not modify for loop counter within a body of the loop

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-5-4 The loop-counter shall be modified by one of: --, ++, -= n, or += n; where n remains constant for the duration of the loop
category.name: M6_5_4

rule.header: The loop-counter shall be modified by one of: --, ++, -=n, or +=n; where n remains constant for the duration of the loop

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-5-5 A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or expression
category.name: M6_5_5

rule.header: A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or expression

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-5-6 A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter which is modified in statement shall have type bool
category.name: M6_5_6

rule.header: A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter which is modified in statement shall have type bool

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-6-1 Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement
category.name: M6_6_1

rule.header: Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-6-2 The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body
category.name: M6_6_2

rule.header: The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body

category.description: AUTOSAR M6-6-3 The continue statement shall only be used within a well-formed for loop
category.name: M6_6_3

rule.header: The continue statement shall only be used within a well formed for loop

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-1-2 A pointer or reference parameter in a function shall be declared as pointer to const or reference to const if the corresponding object is not modified
category.name: M7_1_2

rule.header: Declare a type of parameter as typedef to pointer to const if the pointer is not used to modify the addressed object
A pointer parameter in a function prototype should be declared as pointer to const if the pointer is not used to modify the addressed object
Declare reference parameters as const references whenever possible

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-3-1 The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations
category.name: M7_3_1

rule.header: The global namespace shall only contain main() and namespace declarations

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-3-2 The identifier main shall not be used for a function other than the global function main
category.name: M7_3_2

rule.header: The identifier main shall not be used for a function other than the global function main

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-3-3 There shall be no unnamed namespaces in header files
category.name: M7_3_3

rule.header: There shall be no unnamed namespaces in header files

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-3-4 Using-directives shall not be used
category.name: M7_3_4

rule.header: using-directives shall not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-3-6 Using-directives and using-declarations (excluding class scope or function scope using-declarations) shall not be used in header files
category.name: M7_3_6

rule.header: using-directives and using-declarations (excluding class scope or function scope using-declarations) shall not be used in header files

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-4-1 All usage of assembler shall be documented
category.name: M7_4_1

rule.header: All usage of assembler shall be documented

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-4-2 Assembler instructions shall only be introduced using the asm declaration
category.name: M7_4_2

rule.header: Assembler instructions shall only be introduced using the asm declaration

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-4-3 Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated
category.name: M7_4_3

rule.header: Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated in C/C++ functions

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-5-1 A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to an automatic variable (including parameters), defined within the function
category.name: M7_5_1

rule.header: The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be returned from a function

category.description: AUTOSAR M7-5-2 The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to another object that may persist after the first object has ceased to exist
category.name: M7_5_2

rule.header: The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to another object that may persist after the first object has ceased to exist

category.description: AUTOSAR M8-0-1 An init-declarator-list or a member-declarator-list shall consist of a single init-declarator or member-declarator respectively
category.name: M8_0_1

rule.header: Each variable should be declared in a separate declaration statement

category.description: AUTOSAR M8-3-1 Parameters in an overriding virtual function shall either use the same default arguments as the function they override, or else shall not specify any default arguments
category.name: M8_3_1

rule.header: Do not redefine an inherited virtual function with a different default parameter value

category.description: AUTOSAR M8-4-2 The identifiers used for the parameters in a re-declaration of a function shall be identical to those in the declaration
category.name: M8_4_2

rule.header: The identifiers used in the declaration and definition of a function shall be identical

category.description: AUTOSAR M8-4-4 A function identifier shall either be used to call the function or it shall be preceded by &
category.name: M8_4_4

rule.header: A function identifier shall only be used with either a preceding '&', or with a parenthesised parameter list, which may be empty

category.description: AUTOSAR M8-5-2 Braces shall be used to indicate and match the structure in the non-zero initialization of arrays and structures
category.name: M8_5_2

rule.header: The initializer for an aggregate or union shall be enclosed in braces
Arrays shall not be partially initialized
The non-zero initialization of structures requires an explicit initializer for each element

category.description: AUTOSAR M9-3-1 Const member functions shall not return non-const pointers or references to class-data
category.name: M9_3_1

rule.header: Const member functions shall not return non-const pointers or references to class-data

category.description: AUTOSAR M9-3-3 If a member function can be made static then it shall be made static, otherwise if it can be made const then it shall be made const
category.name: M9_3_3

rule.header: If a member function can be made static then it shall be made static, otherwise if it can be made const then it shall be made const

category.description: AUTOSAR M9-6-4 Named bit-fields with signed integer type shall have a length of more than one bit
category.name: M9_6_4

rule.header: Named bit-fields with signed integer type shall have a length of more than one bit

category.description: AUTOSAR A10-4-1 Hierarchies should be based on interface classes
category.name: A10_4_1

rule.header: Hierarchies should be based on abstract classes

category.description: AUTOSAR A11-0-1 A non-POD type should be defined as class
category.name: A11_0_1

rule.header: A non-POD type should be defined as class

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-4-2 If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, then the class should be declared final
category.name: A12_4_2

rule.header: If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, then the class should be declared final

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-8-2 User-defined copy and move assignment operators should use user-defined no-throw swap function
category.name: A12_8_2

rule.header: User-defined copy and move assignment operators should use user-defined no-throw swap function

category.description: AUTOSAR A12-8-7 Assignment operators should be declared with the ref-qualifier &
category.name: A12_8_7

rule.header: Declare assignment operators with the ref-qualifier &

category.description: AUTOSAR A13-5-3 User-defined conversion operators should not be used
category.name: A13_5_3

rule.header: Do not use user-defined conversion functions

category.description: AUTOSAR A14-5-3 A non-member generic operator shall only be declared in a namespace that does not contain class (struct) type, enum type or union type declarations.
category.name: A14_5_3

rule.header: A non-member generic operator shall only be declared in a namespace that does not contain class (struct) type, enum type or union type declarations

category.description: AUTOSAR A15-1-1 Only instances of types derived from std::exception shall be thrown
category.name: A15_1_1

rule.header: Only use instances of std::exception for exceptions

category.description: AUTOSAR A2-13-5 Hexadecimal constants should be upper case
category.name: A2_13_5

rule.header: Hexadecimal constants will be represented using all uppercase letters

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-1-3 Implementation files, that are defined locally in the project, should have a file name extension of ".cpp"
category.name: A3_1_3

rule.header: Implementation files in C++ will always have a file name extension of ".cpp"

category.description: AUTOSAR A3-1-6 Trivial accessor and mutator functions should be inlined
category.name: A3_1_6

rule.header: Trivial accessor and mutator functions should be inlined

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-1-6 Return type of a non-void return type lambda expression should be explicitly specified
category.name: A5_1_6

rule.header: Return type of a non-void return type lambda expression should be explicitly specified

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-1-8 Lambda expressions should not be defined inside another lambda expression
category.name: A5_1_8

rule.header: Lambda expressions should not be defined inside another lambda expression

category.description: AUTOSAR A5-2-1 dynamic_cast should not be used
category.name: A5_2_1

rule.header: Avoid dynamic_casts

category.description: AUTOSAR A6-5-3 Do statements should not be used
category.name: A6_5_3

rule.header: 'Do' statements should not be used except in a function-like macro

category.description: AUTOSAR A6-5-4 For-init-statement and expression should not perform actions other than loop-counter initialization and modification
category.name: A6_5_4

rule.header: The initialization expression in a for loop will perform no actions other than to initialize the value of a single for loop parameter
The increment expression in a for loop will perform no action other than to change a single loop parameter to the next value for the loop

category.description: AUTOSAR A7-2-5 Enumerations should be used to represent sets of related named constants
category.name: A7_2_5

rule.header: Enumeration types shall be used instead of integer types (and constants) as case labels

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-3 Common ways of passing parameters should be used
category.name: A8_4_3

rule.header: A parameter of a type that is not 'cheap to copy' should be passed by reference
Declare reference parameters as const references whenever possible

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-4-4 Multiple output values from a function should be returned as a struct or tuple
category.name: A8_4_4

rule.header: Multiple output values from a function should be returned as a struct or tuple

category.description: AUTOSAR A8-5-4 If a class has a user-declared constructor that takes a parameter of type std::initializer_list, then it shall be the only constructor apart from special member function constructors
category.name: A8_5_4

rule.header: Avoid overloading constructors with std::initializer_list

category.description: AUTOSAR M0-1-10 Every defined function should be called at least once
category.name: M0_1_10

rule.header: Every defined function with internal linkage shall be used at least once

category.description: AUTOSAR M10-1-1 Classes should not be derived from virtual bases
category.name: M10_1_1

rule.header: Classes should not be derived from virtual bases

category.description: AUTOSAR M10-2-1 All accessible entity names within a multiple inheritance hierarchy should be unique
category.name: M10_2_1

rule.header: All accessible entity names within a multiple inheritance hierarchy should be unique

category.description: AUTOSAR M16-3-2 The # and ## operators should not be used
category.name: M16_3_2

rule.header: The # and ## preprocessor operators should not be used

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-0-2 Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions
category.name: M5_0_2

rule.header: Use parenthesis for the right-hand operand of an assignment operator when it contains an assignment expression
Limited dependence should be placed on C's operator precedence rules in expressions
No parentheses are required for the operand of a unary operator
Limited dependence should be placed on C's operator precedence rules in expressions
Use parentheses unless all operators in the expression are the same
Limited dependence should be placed on C's operator precedence rules in expressions

category.description: AUTOSAR M5-2-3 Casts from a base class to a derived class should not be performed on polymorphic types
category.name: M5_2_3

rule.header: Casts from a base class to a derived class should not be performed on polymorphic types
Line-splicing shall not be used in // comments
Prefer C++ style comment
Provide copyright information
Every source file will be documented with an introductory comment that provides information on the file
Document functions in comments that precede function definitions
Document functions in comments that precede function declarations
Each variable declaration should be commented
Each typedef should be commented
Each enumeration value should be commented
Each structure member variable should be commented
All usage of assembler shall be documented
Use of floating-point arithmetic shall be documented
The character sequence // shall not be used within a C-style comment
The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C++-style comment
All declarations of types, data members, and functions should be preceded by a comment annotated with the '@brief' tag
Function parameters and return type should be documented in a comment that precedes the function declaration

category.description: Joint Strike Fighter
category.name: JSF

rule.header: All functions shall have a cyclomatic complexity number of 20 or less
Follow the Essential Complexity limit of 1
Capital 'L' shall be used instead of lowercase 'l' to indicate long
Ensure that array indices are within the bounds of the array
The error indicator 'errno' shall not be used
The macro 'offsetof', in library <stddef.h>, shall not be used
'setlocale' function shall not be used
<locale.h> shall not be used
The 'setjmp' macro and the 'longjmp' function shall not be used
The standard header file <setjmp.h> shall not be used
The standard header file <signal.h> shall not be used
The signal handling facilities of <signal.h> shall not be used
The input/output library <stdio.h> shall not be used
The library functions atof, atoi and atol from library <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library function 'abort' of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library function 'exit' of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library function 'getenv' of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library function 'system' of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The time handling functions of library <time.h> shall not be used
The #ifdef, #else, #elif preprocessor directives should not be used
The #if preprocessor directive should not be used
#error directive shall not be used
The #pragma directive shall not be used
#undef shall not be used
The #define pre-processor directive shall not be used to create inline macros
The #define pre-processor directive shall not be used to define constant values
The #include directive shall use the <filename.h> notation to include header files
User-specified C++ external identifiers should differ in the first 64 characters
User-specified C++ internal identifiers should differ from external identifiers in the first 64 characters
User-specified C++ internal identifiers declared in the same scope should differ in the first 64 characters
Identifiers for constant and enumerator values shall be lowercase
The following character sequences shall not appear in header file names: ', \, /*, //, or "
The statements forming the body of a 'while', 'do...while', 'switch' or 'for' statement shall always be enclosed in braces
The statements forming the body of an 'if', 'else if' or 'else' statement shall always be enclosed in braces
Declare both private copy constructor and copy assignment operator at the same time
Freed memory shall not be accessed under any circumstances
Destructor shall not be called manually
Public and protected methods shall not be invoked by class constructor
A class's virtual functions shall not be invoked from any of its constructors
A class's virtual functions shall not be invoked from its destructor
All member variables shall be initialized in constructor
A class's virtual functions shall not be invoked from any of its constructors
Uninitialized nonstatic member variables shall not be used in base class constructors
Uninitialized nonstatic member variables of nonvirtual base classes shall not be used in virtual base class constructors
Possibly uninitialized nonstatic member variables of base classes shall not be used in base class constructors
Members of the initialization list shall be listed in the order in which they are declared in the class
A copy constructor and a copy assignment operator shall be declared for classes that contain pointers to data items or nontrivial destructors
A copy constructor shall copy all data members and bases
The definition of a constructor shall not contain default arguments that produce a signature identical to that of the implicitly-declared copy constructor
All base classes with a virtual function shall define a virtual destructor
Call fclose() on pointer member in destructor if the pointer was used to open a file
Call delete on pointer members in destructors
The assignment operator shall handle self-assignment correctly
An assignment operator shall return a reference to *this
An assignment operator shall assign all data members
An assignment operator shall assign all data bases
Multiple inheritance shall be limited to at most 1 protected implementation
A stateful virtual base shall be explicitly declared in each derived class that accesses it
Multiple inheritance shall not use any public implementations
A base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy
An inherited nonvirtual function shall not be redefined in a derived class
Member functions declared in derived class shall not hide functions declared in base classes
An inherited default parameter shall never be redefined
Arrays shall not be treated polymorphically
Arrays shall not be used in interfaces
Neither operand of an equality operator (== or !=) shall be a pointer to a virtual member function
Arrays shall not be used in private or protected methods
Arrays shall not be used in global functions
Arrays shall not be passed to functions as array/pointer parameters
Functions which are called with array argument shall not be declared with pointer parameter
Functions shall always be declared at file scope
Functions with variable numbers of arguments shall not be used
A function shall not return a pointer or reference to a non-static local object
A function shall not return a pointer or a reference to a parameter that is passed by const reference
All exit points of value-returning functions shall be through return statements
Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly
Only valid C++ style comments (//) shall be used
Code that is not used (commented out) shall be deleted
Identifier declared in a local or function prototype scope shall not hide an identifier declared in a global or namespace scope
Identifiers declared in an inner local scope shall not hide identifiers declared in an outer local scope
Identifiers declared in a local scope shall not hide identifiers declared in a class scope
Identifiers declared in a class scope shall not hide identifiers declared in a global or namespace scope
Identifiers declared in an inner class scope shall not hide identifiers declared in outer class scope
Identifiers shall not simultaneously have both internal and external linkage in the same translation unit
The static storage class specifier shall be used in definitions and declarations of objects and functions that have internal linkage
The register storage class specifier shall not be used
All automatic variables shall have been assigned a value before being used
All variables shall be initialized before use
Braces shall be used to indicate and match the structure in the non-zero initialization of arrays and structures
In an enumerator list, the '=' construct shall not be used to explicitly initialize members other than the first, unless all items are explicitly initialized
The underlying bit representations of floating point numbers shall not be used in any way by the programmer
Enumeration types shall be used instead of integer types (and constants) to select from a limited series of choices
Octal constants (other than zero) shall not be used
A string literal shall not be modified
Multiple variable declarations shall not be allowed on the same line
Unions shall not be used
Bit-fields shall have explicitly unsigned integral or enumeration types only
All the members of a structure (or class) shall be named
The right hand operand of a && or || operator shall not contain side effects
The operands of a logical && or || shall be parenthesized if the operands contain binary operators
Operators ||, && shall not be overloaded
Operator unary & shall not be overloaded
An assignment expression shall be used only as the expression in an expression statement
Signed and unsigned values shall not be mixed in comparison operations
Signed and unsigned values shall not be mixed in second and third operand of conditional operator
Signed and unsigned values shall not be mixed in arithmetic operations
Unsigned arithmetic shall not be used
The left-hand operand of a right-shift operator shall not have a negative value
The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an unsigned expression
Don't assign the dividend of two integers to a floating-point type
The comma operator shall not be used
More than 2 levels of pointer indirection shall not be used
The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to an object which persists after the object has ceased to exist
The null pointer shall not be de-referenced
The null pointer shall not be de-referenced
NULL identifier shall not be used; use plain 0 instead
Down casting (casting from base to derived class) shall not be allowed
A pointer to a virtual base class shall not be converted to a pointer to a derived class
Implicit conversions from wider to narrower integral type which may result in a loss of information shall not be used
Avoid implicit conversions from floating to integral type
Avoid implicit conversions from wider to narrower floating type
Avoid conversions of constant values to a narrower type
Avoid implicit conversions from signed to unsigned type
Implicit conversions from integral to floating type which may result in a loss of information shall not be used
Implicit conversions from integral constant to floating type which may result in a loss of information shall not be used
Type casting from any type to or from pointers shall not be used
Floating point numbers shall not implicitly be converted to integers
C-style casts (other than void casts) and functional notation casts (other than explicit constructor calls) shall not be used
There shall be no unreachable code in 'else' block
There shall be no unreachable code after 'return', 'break', 'continue', and 'goto' statements
There shall be no unreachable code in 'if', 'else', 'while' and 'for' block
There shall be no unreachable code in 'switch' statement
There shall be no unreachable code in 'for' loop
There shall be no unreachable code after 'if' or 'switch' statement
There shall be no unreachable code after 'if' or 'switch' statement inside 'while', 'for' or 'do...while' loop
Every defined function with internal linkage shall be used
All non-null statements shall potentially have a side-effect
The goto statement shall not be used
The continue statement shall not be used
The break statement shall not be used (except to terminate the cases of a switch statement)
For any iteration statement there shall be no more than one break or goto statement used for loop termination
Every non-empty case clause in a switch statement shall be terminated with a break statement
All switch statements that do not intend to test for every enumeration value shall contain a final default clause
Floating point variables shall not be used as loop counters
Numeric variables being used within a for loop for iteration counting shall not be modified in the body of the loop
Floating point variables shall not be tested for exact equality or inequality
Evaluation of expressions shall not lead to overflow/underflow
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
Don't write code that depends on the order of evaluation of function arguments
Don't write code that depends on the order of evaluation of function designator and function arguments
Don't write code that depends on the order of evaluation of expression that involves a function call
Between sequence points an object shall have its stored value modified at most once by the evaluation of an expression
Do not use more than one volatile in one expression
Don't write code that depends on the order of evaluation of function calls
A single operation with side-effect shall only be used in the proper context
A call of function with side-effect shall only be used in the proper context
The second or third operand of a ternary operator '?:' shall not contain side effects
The volatile keyword shall not be used
Dynamic heap memory allocation shall not be used
C++ exceptions shall not be used
Typedefs that indicate size and signedness shall be used in place of the basic types
Typedefs that indicate size and signedness shall be used in place of the basic types
Algorithms shall not make assumptions concerning the order of allocation of nonstatic data members separated by an access specifier
Algorithms shall not assume particular memory alignment
Use parenthesis to clarify expression order if operators with precedence lower than arithmetic are used
Assuming that non-local static objects, in separate translation units, are initialized in a special order shall not be done
Any one function (or method) will contain no more than 200 logical source lines of code (L-SLOCs)
Only those characters specified in the C++ basic source character set will be used
Values of character types will be restricted to a defined and documented subset of ISO 10646-1
Trigraphs will not be used
The following digraphs will not be used <%, %>, <:, :>, %:, %:%:
Wide string literals (for example L"abc") will not be used
#ifndef, #define and #endif will be used to prevent multiple inclusions of the same header file
The #ifndef pre-processor directive will only be used to prevent multiple inclusions of the same header file
The #endif pre-processor directives will only be used to prevent multiple inclusions of the same header file
The #define pre-processor directive will only be used as part of the technique to prevent multiple inclusions of the same header file
The #include pre-processor directive will only be used to include header (*.h) files
A header file will contain a mechanism that prevents multiple inclusions of itself
Header files (*.h) will not contain non-const variable definitions or function definitions
Source lines will be kept to a length of 120 characters or less
Each expression-statement will be on a separate line
All indentations will be consistent
Identifiers will not begin with the underscore character "_"
Identifiers will not differ by mixture of case, the underscore character, interchange of the similarly looking letters and numbers
Begin class, struct, union, enum, and typedef names with an uppercase letter
All letters contained in function and variable names will be composed entirely of lowercase letters
Header files will always have a file name extension of ".h"
Implementation files will always have a file name extension of ".cpp"
The public section of a class will be declared before the protected section and before the private section
The protected section of a class will be declared before the private section

When declaring functions with more than 2 parameters, the leading parenthesis and the first argument are to be written on the same line as the function name, each additional argument will be written on a separate line
Braces ("{}") which enclose a block will have nothing else on the line except comments
Braces ("{}") which enclose a block will be placed in the same column
Braces ("{}") which enclose a block will not have an empty line after "{" nor before "}"
Braces ("{}") which enclose a block will have nothing else on the line except comments
The dereference operator '*' and the address-of operator '&' will be directly connected with the type-specifier
There will be no white space following '.' or '->' operator
There will be no white space preceding '.' or '->' operator
There will be no space between a unary operator '!' or '~' and its operand
There will be no space between a increment/decrement operator (++/--) and its operand
There will be no space between a unary operator '&', '*', '+', '-' and its operand
There should be no space between an increment/decrement operator (++/--) and its operand in macro definition
A member function that does not affect the state of an object will be declared const
Initialization of nonstatic class members will be performed through the member initialization list rather than through assignment in the body of a constructor
When two operators are opposites (such as == and !=), both will be defined
When one of opposite operators (== and !=) is defined, the other should be defined too and one will be defined in terms of the other
Namespaces will not be nested more than two levels deep
All partial and explicit specializations for a template should be declared in the same file as the declaration of their primary template
Functions with more than 7 arguments will not be used
Functions will have a single exit point
If a function returns error information, then that error information will be tested
Each variable declaration will be commented
Each typedef will be commented
Each enumeration value will be commented
Each structure member variable will be commented
Every source file will be documented with an introductory comment that provides information on the file
Every source file will contain copyright information
External objects will not be declared in more than one file
External objects will not be declared in implementation files
A class, structure, or enumeration will not be declared in the definition of its type
Variables will not be introduced until they can be initialized with meaningful values
Avoid unused local variables
Hexadecimal constants will be represented using all uppercase letters
Numeric values in code will not be used; symbolic values will be used instead
The sizeof operator will not be used on expressions that contain side effects
The sizeof operator will not be used on expressions that contain side effects
The sizeof operator will not be used on expressions that contain side effects
The implementation of integer division shall be documented
A typedef will be used to simplify program syntax when declaring function pointers
Redundant explicit casts will not be used
Avoid explicit cast from derived to a base class
Labels will not be used, except in switch statements
All 'if...else if' constructs will contain either a final else clause or a comment indicating why a final else clause is not necessary
A switch expression will not represent a Boolean value
Every switch statement will have at least two cases and a potential default
The initialization expression in a for loop will perform no actions other than to initialize the value of a single for loop parameter
The increment expression in a for loop will perform no action other than to change a single loop parameter to the next value for the loop
Null initialize or increment expressions in for loops will not be used; a while loop will be used instead
Unencapsulated global data will be avoided
A file should directly include only headers containing declarations and definitions needed to a compilation
Tabs should be avoided
Public data should only be used in structs, not in classes
Protected data should only be used in structs, not in classes
Avoid using the friend mechanism
Hierarchies should be based on abstract classes
Every nonlocal name, except main(), should be placed in some namespace
Don't write namespace usings in a header file or before an #include
In a class template with a dependent base, any name that may be found in that dependent base should be referred to using a qualifier
A function definition should not be placed in a class specification
Dereferenced local pointer initialized by new in function scope should not be returned
Value returned by a function having a non-void return type that is not an overloaded operator shall always be used
Built-in-types should be passed by value unless you are modifying them
Arguments should be passed by reference
An object should be passed as const reference if the function should not change the value of the object
Avoid slicing function arguments / return value
The class object should be passed by reference if the class has non-static pointers and has no declared copy constructor
A pointer parameter in a function prototype should be declared as pointer to const if the pointer is not used to modify the addressed object
Declare a type of parameter as typedef to pointer to const if the pointer is not used to modify the addressed object
Only functions with 1 or 2 statements should be considered candidates for inline functions
Trivial accessor and mutator functions should be inlined
Classes which have only getters/setters (accessors/mutators) are not allowed
Trivial forwarding functions should be inlined
Pass and return by reference when possible
Document functions in comments that precede function definitions
Document functions in comments that precede function declarations
Objects should be defined at block scope if they are only accessed from within a single function
Declarations of local variables should be at the smallest feasible scope
All declarations at file scope should be static where possible
Pointers to pointers should be avoided
User-defined conversion functions should be avoided
Constructors allowing for conversion should be made explicit
Every possible measure should be taken to avoid type casting
Avoid using static_cast on pointers
Avoid using reinterpret_cast
Pointer arithmetic will not be used
Consider using op= instead of stand-alone op

category.description: MISRA C++ 2008
category.name: MISRA2008

rule.header: Every defined function with internal linkage shall be used
There shall be no unused parameters (named or unnamed) in nonvirtual functions
A project shall not contain unreachable code in 'else' block
A project shall not contain unreachable code after 'return', 'break', 'continue', and 'goto' statements
A project shall not contain unreachable code in 'if/else/while/for' block
A project shall not contain unreachable code in switch statement
A project shall not contain unreachable code in 'for' loop
A project shall not contain unreachable code after 'if' or 'switch' statement outside 'for/while/catch' block
A project shall not contain unreachable code after 'if' or 'switch' statement inside 'while/for/catch' block
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain infeasible paths
A project shall not contain unused variables
A project shall not contain unused variables
Eliminate unused private member variables
A project should not contain unused variables with internal linkage
The value returned by a function having a non-void return type that is not an overloaded operator shall always be used
All functions with void return type shall have external side effect(s)
All functions with void return type shall have external side effect(s)
All non-null statements shall either have at least one side-effect however executed or cause control flow to change
An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object
An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object
If a function generates error information, then that error information shall be tested
An accessible base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy
There shall be no more than one definition of each virtual function on each path through the inheritance hierarchy
Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with the virtual keyword
A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual
Member data in non-POD class types shall be private
All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit
A copy constructor shall only initialize its base classes and the nonstatic members of the class of which it is a member
The copy assignment operator shall be declared protected or private in an abstract class
Do not declare non-member generic functions in associated namespaces
A copy constructor shall be declared when there is a template constructor with a single parameter that is a generic parameter
A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is a generic parameter
In a class template with a dependent base, any name that may be found in that dependent base shall be referred to using a qualified-id or this->
The function shall resolve to a function declared previously in the translation unit
All partial and explicit specializations for a template shall be declared in the same file as the declaration of their primary template
Overloaded function templates shall not be explicitly specialized
Control shall not be transferred into a try or catch block using a goto or a switch statement
The assignment-expression of a throw statement shall not itself cause an exception to be thrown
NULL shall not be thrown explicitly
An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in the compound statement of a catch handler
Exceptions shall be raised only after start-up and before termination of the program
Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor or destructor shall not reference non-static members from this class or its bases
Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point
Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point
A class type exception shall always be caught by reference
Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block for a derived class and some or all of its bases, the handlers shall be ordered most-derived to base class
Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block, any ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur last
A class destructor shall not exit with an exception
Where a function's declaration includes an exception-specification, the function shall only be capable of throwing exceptions of the indicated type(s)
The execution of a function registered with 'std::atexit()' or 'std::at_quick_exit()' should not exit via an exception
Never allow an exception to be thrown from a destructor, deallocation, and swap
Do not throw from within destructor
There should be at least one exception handler to catch all otherwise unhandled exceptions
An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in the compound-statement of a catch handler
Exceptions shall be raised only after start-up and before termination of the program
Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point
Where a function's declaration includes an exception-specification, the function shall only be capable of throwing exceptions of the indicated type(s)
Function called in global or namespace scope shall not throw unhandled exceptions
#include directives in a file shall only be preceded by other preprocessor directives or comments
Macros shall only be #define'd or #undef'd in the global namespace
#undef shall not be used
Function-like macros shall not be defined
Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like preprocessing directives
In the definition of a function-like macro, each instance of a parameter shall be enclosed in parentheses, unless it is used as the operand of # or ##
Do not use in preprocessor directives #if and #elif macros not defined in translation unit
If the # token appears as the first token on a line, then it shall be immediately followed by a preprocessing token
The defined preprocessor operator shall only be used in one of the two standard forms
All #else, #elif and #endif preprocessor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if or #ifdef directive to which they are related
Avoid using macro definitions
The #ifndef pre-processor directive will only be used to prevent multiple inclusions of the same header file
The #ifdef, #else, #elif preprocessor directives should not be used
The #endif pre-processor directives will only be used to prevent multiple inclusions of the same header file
The #if pre-processor directive will only be used to prevent multiple inclusions of the same header file
#error directive shall not be used
The #pragma directive shall not be used
#undef shall not be used
C++ macros shall only be used for: include guards, type qualifiers, or storage class specifiers
Include guards shall be provided
The ', ", /* or // characters shall not occur in a header file name
The #include directive shall be followed by either a <filename> or "filename" sequence
There shall be at most one occurrence of the # or ## operators in a single macro definition
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined
Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined
The names of standard library macros and objects shall not be reused
The names of standard library functions shall not be overridden
The setjmp macro and the longjmp function shall not be used
The standard header file <setjmp.h> shall not be used
The C library shall not be used
The library functions atof, atoi and atol from library <cstdlib> shall not be used
The library function 'abort' of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library function 'exit' of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library function 'getenv' of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library function 'system' of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The standard header file <ctime> shall not be used
The time handling functions and macros of library <ctime> shall not be used
The types defined in the library <ctime> shall not be used
The unbounded functions of library <cstring> shall not be used
The macro offsetof shall not be used
Dynamic heap memory allocation shall not be used
The standard header file <csignal> shall not be used
The signal handling facilities of <csignal> shall not be used
The error indicator errno shall not be used
The stream input/output library <cstdio> shall not be used
Different identifiers shall be typographically unambiguous
Identifiers declared in an inner scope shall not hide an identifier declared in an outer scope
Identifiers declared in an inner scope shall not hide an identifier declared in an outer scope
If an identifier refers to a type, it shall not also refer to an object or a function in the same scope
If an identifier refers to a type, it shall not also refer to an object or a function in the same scope
If an identifier refers to a type, it shall not also refer to an object or a function in the same scope
Only those escape sequences that are defined in ISO/IEC 14882:2003 shall be used
Octal constants (other than zero) shall not be used
Octal escape sequences (other than "\0") shall not be used
A "U" suffix shall be applied to all octal or hexadecimal integer literals of unsigned type
Literal suffixes shall be upper case
Narrow and wide string literals shall not be concatenated
Trigraphs shall not be used
The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment
Sections of code shall not be "commented out" using C-style comments
It shall be possible to include any header file in multiple translation units without violating the One Definition Rule
Functions shall not be declared at block scope
When an array is declared, its size shall either be stated explicitly or defined implicitly by initialization
Objects or functions with external linkage shall be declared in a header file
If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class specifier
An identifier declared to be an object or type shall be defined in a block that minimizes its visibility
An identifier declared to be an object or type shall be defined in a block that minimizes its visibility
The types used for an object, a function return type, or a function parameter shall be token-for-token identical in all declarations and re-declarations
The underlying bit representations of floating-point values shall not be used
NULL shall not be used as an integer value
Literal zero (0) shall not be used as the null-pointer-constant

Expressions with type bool shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the logical operators &&, ||, !, the equality operators == and !=, the unary & operator, and the conditional operator
Expressions with type enum shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than [ ], =, ==, !=, <, <=, >, >=, and the unary & operator
Expressions with type (plain) char and wchar_t shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the equality operators == and !=, and the unary & operator
If the bitwise operators ~ and << are applied to an operand with an underlying type of unsigned char or unsigned short, the result shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand
The plain char type shall only be used for the storage and use of character values
signed char and unsigned char type shall only be used for the storage and use of numeric values
The condition of an if-statement and the condition of an iteration-statement shall have type bool
The first operand of a conditional-operator shall have type bool
Array indexing shall be the only form of pointer arithmetic
The declaration of objects shall contain no more than two levels of pointer indirection
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
Non-constant operands to a binary bitwise operator shall have the same underlying type
Bitwise operators shall only be applied to operands of unsigned underlying type
A cvalue expression shall not be implicitly converted to a different underlying type
A cvalue expression shall not be implicitly converted to a different underlying type
A cvalue expression shall not be implicitly converted to a different underlying type
An implicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type
There shall be no implicit floating-integral conversions
There shall be no implicit floating-integral conversions
An implicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not reduce the size of the underlying type
An implicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not reduce the size of the underlying type
An implicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not reduce the size of the underlying type
There shall be no explicit floating-integral conversions of a cvalue expression
There shall be no explicit floating-integral conversions of a cvalue expression
An explicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not increase the size of the underlying type of a cvalue expression
An explicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not increase the size of the underlying type of a cvalue expression
An explicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type of a cvalue expression
The right hand operand of a logical && or || operator shall not contain side effects
The overloaded binary operator should be implemented in terms of its corresponding compound assignment operator
The comma operator shall not be used
Each operand of a logical && or || shall be a postfix-expression
The && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded
The comma "," operator shall not be overloaded
An identifier with array type passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer
A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast
C-style casts (other than void casts) and functional notation casts (other than explicit constructor calls) shall not be used
A cast shall not remove any const or volatile qualification from the type of a pointer or reference
A cast shall not convert a pointer to a function to any other pointer type, including a pointer to function type
An object with pointer type shall not be converted to an unrelated pointer type, either directly or indirectly
An object with integer type or pointer to void type shall not be converted to an object with pointer type
Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool
The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned
The unary & operator shall not be overloaded
Evaluation of the operand to the sizeof operator shall not contain side effects
Evaluation of the operand to the sizeof operator shall not contain side effects
Evaluation of the operand to the sizeof operator shall not contain side effects
The right hand operand of a shift operator shall lie between zero and one less than the width in bits of the underlying type of the left hand operand
Assignment operators shall not be used in sub-expressions
Floating-point expressions shall not be directly or indirectly tested for equality or inequality
Before preprocessing, a null statement shall only occur on a line by itself; it may be followed by a comment, provided that the first character following the null statement is a white-space character
The statement forming the body of a switch, while, do while or for statement shall be a compound statement
An if ( condition ) construct shall be followed by a compound statement. The else keyword shall be followed by either a compound statement, or another if statement
All if ... else if constructs shall be terminated with an else clause
A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement
A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement
A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement
A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement
A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement
A switch-label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement
An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause
The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause
The condition of a switch statement shall not have bool type
Every switch statement shall have at least one case-clause
A for loop shall contain a single loop-counter which shall not have floating type
If loop-counter is not modified by -- or ++, then, within condition, the loop-counter shall only be used as an operand to <=, <, > or >=
The loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or statement
The loop-counter shall be modified by one of: --, ++, -=n, or +=n; where n remains constant for the duration of the loop
A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or expression
A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter which is modified in statement within a body of the loop shall have type bool
Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement
The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body
The continue statement shall only be used within a well-formed for loop
For any iteration statement there shall be no more than one break or goto statement used for loop termination
A function shall have a single point of exit at the end of the function
Declare local variable as const whenever possible
Declare parameters as const whenever possible
A pointer parameter in a function shall be declared as pointer to const if the corresponding object is not modified
A reference parameter in a function shall be declared as reference to const if the corresponding object is not modified
Declare a type of parameter as typedef to pointer to const if the pointer is not used to modify the addressed object
An expression with enum underlying type shall only have values corresponding to the enumerators of the enumeration
The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations
The identifier main shall not be used for a function other than the global function main
There shall be no unnamed namespaces in header files
using-directives shall not be used
Multiple declarations for an identifier in the same namespace shall not straddle a using-declaration for that identifier
using-directives and using-declarations (excluding class scope or function scope using-declarations) shall not be used in header files
Assembler instructions shall only be introduced using the asm declaration
Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to an automatic variable (including parameters), defined within the function
The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to another object that may persist after the first object has ceased to exist
The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to another object that may persist after the first object has ceased to exist
A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by reference or const reference
An init-declarator-list or a member-declarator-list shall consist of a single init-declarator or member-declarator respectively
Parameters in an overriding virtual function shall either use the same default arguments as the function they override, or else shall not specify any default arguments
Functions shall not be defined using the ellipsis notation
The identifiers used for the parameters in a re-declaration of a function shall be identical to those in the declaration
All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression
A function identifier shall either be used to call the function or it shall be preceded by '&'
All variables shall have a defined value before they are used
Braces shall be used to indicate and match the structure in the non-zero initialization of arrays and structures
Arrays shall not be partially initialized
Structures shall not be partially initialized
In an enumerator list, the = construct shall not be used to explicitly initialize members other than the first, unless all items are explicitly initialized
const member functions shall not return non-const pointers or references to class-data
Protected member functions shall not return non-const handles to class-data
Public member functions shall not return non-const handles to class-data
If a member function can be made static then it shall be made static, otherwise if it can be made const then it shall be made const
Unions shall not be used
Bit-fields shall be either bool type or an explicitly unsigned or signed integral type
Bit-fields shall not have enum type
Named bit-fields with signed integer type shall have a length of more than one bit
Classes should not be derived from virtual bases
All accessible entity names within a multiple inheritance hierarchy should be unique
All constructors of a class should explicitly call a constructor for all of its immediate base classes and all virtual base classes
The viable function set for a function call should either contain no function specializations, or only contain function specializations
An exception object should not have pointer type
There should be at least one exception handler to catch all otherwise unhandled exceptions
The \ character should not occur in a header file name
The # and ## operators should not be used
Digraphs should not be used
Sections of code should not be "commented out" using C++ comments
typedefs that indicate size and signedness should be used in place of the basic numerical types
Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions
Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions
Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions
Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions
Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions
Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions
Integer overflow or underflow in constant expression in '+', '-', '*' operator
Integer overflow or underflow in constant expression in '<<' operator
The increment (++) and decrement (--) operators should not be mixed with arithmetic operators in an expression
Casts from a base class to a derived class should not be performed on polymorphic types
A cast should not convert a pointer type to an integral type
Functions should not call themselves, either directly or indirectly
Use of floating-point arithmetic shall be documented
All uses of the #pragma directive shall be documented
All usage of assembler shall be documented

category.description: MISRA C++ 202X
category.name: MISRACPP202X

category.description: Rule 0025 (Required) The character sequence "/*" shall not be used within a C-style comment

rule.header: The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment

category.description: Rule 0035 (Required) Octal constants shall not be used

rule.header: Octal constants (other than zero) shall not be used

category.description: Rule 0036 (Required) Unsigned integer literals shall be appropriately suffixed

rule.header: A 'U' suffix shall be applied to all constants of unsigned type

category.description: Rule 0042 (Required) Function-like macros shall not be defined

rule.header: A function should be used in preference to a function-like macro

category.description: Rule 0043 (Required) Tokens that look like a preprocessing directive shall not occur within a macro argument

rule.header: Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like preprocessing directives

category.description: Rule 0045 (Required) All identifiers used in the controlling expression of #if or #elif preprocessing directives shall be #define'd at the point of evaluation

rule.header: Do not use in preprocessor directives #if and #elif macros not defined in translation unit

category.description: Rule 0046 (Required) A line whose first token is "#" shall be a valid preprocessing directive

rule.header: Preprocessing directives shall be syntactically meaningful even when excluded by the preprocessor

category.description: Rule 0064 (Required) "nullptr" shall be the only form of the null-pointer-constant

rule.header: Prefer 'nullptr' over 'NULL' or '0'(zero)

category.description: Rule 0087 (Required) A virtual base class shall only be cast to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast

rule.header: A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast

category.description: Rule 0089 (Required) C-style casts and functional notation casts shall not be used

rule.header: C-style casts (other than void casts) and functional notation casts (other than explicit constructor calls) shall not be used

category.description: Rule 0090 (Required) A cast shall not remove any const or volatile qualification from the type accessed via a pointer or by reference

rule.header: A cast shall not remove any 'const' or 'volatile' qualification from the type of a pointer or reference

category.description: Rule 0096 (Required) The comma, logical AND and logical OR operators shall not be overloaded

rule.header: Avoid overloading logical operators AND, OR (&&, ||)
Avoid overloading comma operator ","

category.description: Rule 0097 (Required) An array passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer

rule.header: Do not pass an expression with array type to a function with a pointer or array type parameter

category.description: Rule 0100 (Required) The address-of operator shall not be overloaded

rule.header: The unary & operator shall not be overloaded
